      and to those who speak evil against my soul.
109:20 But deal you with me, O LORD God, according unto your Name; *
      for sweet is your mercy.
109:21 O deliver me, for I am helpless and poor, *
      and my heart is wounded within me.
109:22 I go hence like the shadow that departs, *
      and am driven away as the grasshopper.
109:23 My knees are weak through fasting; *
      my flesh is dried up for want of fatness.
109:24 I became also a reproach unto them; *
      they that looked upon me shaked their heads.
109:25 Help me, O LORD my God; *
      O save me according to your mercy.
109:26 And they shall know how that this is your hand, *
      and that you, LORD, have done it.
109:27 Though they curse, yet bless you; *
      and let them be confounded that rise up against me; but let your servant rejoice.
109:28 Let mine adversaries be clothed with shame; *
      and let them cover themselves with their own confusion, as with a cloak.
109:29 As for me, I will give great thanks unto the LORD with my mouth, *
      and praise him among the multitude.
109:30 For he shall stand at the right hand of the poor, *
      to save his soul from unrighteous judges.

text.NRSV:
110:1 The Lord says to my lord, 'Sit at my right hand until I make your enemies your footstool.'
110:2 The Lord sends out from Zion your mighty scepter. Rule in the midst of your foes.
110:3 Your people will offer themselves willingly on the day you lead your forces on the holy mountains. From the womb of the morning, like dew, your youth will come to you.
110:4 The Lord has sworn and will not change his mind, 'You are a priest forever according to the order of Melchizedek.'
110:5 The Lord is at your right hand; he will shatter kings on the day of his wrath.
110:6 He will execute judgment among the nations, filling them with corpses; he will shatter heads over the wide earth.
110:7 He will drink from the stream by the path; therefore he will lift up his head.
text.Coverdale:
110:1 The LORD said unto my Lord, *
      "Sit you on my right hand, until I make your enemies your footstool."
110:2 The LORD shall send the rod of your power out of Zion; *
      "Be you ruler, even in the midst among your enemies."
110:3 In the day of your power shall the people offer you free-will offerings with an holy worship; *
      the dew of your birth is of the womb of the morning.
110:4 The LORD sware, and will not repent, *
      "You are a Priest for ever after the order of Melchizedek."
110:5 The Lord upon your right hand *
      shall wound even kings in the day of his wrath.
110:6 He shall judge among the heathen; he shall fill the places with the dead bodies, *
      and smite in sunder the heads over divers countries.
110:7 He shall drink of the brook in the way; *
      therefore shall he lift up his head.

text.NRSV:
111:1 Praise the Lord! I will give thanks to the Lord with my whole heart, in the company of the upright, in the congregation.
111:2 Great are the works of the Lord, studied by all who delight in them.
111:3 Full of honor and majesty is his work, and his righteousness endures forever.
111:4 He has gained renown by his wonderful deeds; the Lord is gracious and merciful.
111:5 He provides food for those who fear him; he is ever mindful of his covenant.
111:6 He has shown his people the power of his works, in giving them the heritage of the nations.
111:7 The works of his hands are faithful and just; all his precepts are trustworthy.
111:8 They are established forever and ever, to be performed with faithfulness and uprightness.
111:9 He sent redemption to his people; he has commanded his covenant forever. Holy and awesome is his name.
111:10 The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom; all those who practice it have a good understanding. His praise endures forever.
text.Coverdale:
111:1 I will give thanks unto the LORD with my whole heart, *
      secretly among the faithful, and in the congregation.
111:2 The works of the LORD are great, *
      sought out of all them that have pleasure therein.
111:3 His work is worthy to be praised and had in honor, *
      and his righteousness endures for ever.
111:4 The merciful and gracious LORD has so done his marvelous works, *
      that they ought to be had in remembrance.
111:5 He has given meat unto them that fear him; *
      he shall ever be mindful of his covenant.
111:6 He has showed his people the power of his works, *
      that he may give them the heritage of the heathen.
111:7 The works of his hands are verity and judgment; *
      all his commandments are true.
111:8 They stand fast for ever and ever, *
      and are done in truth and equity.
111:9 He sent redemption unto his people; *
      he has commanded his covenant for ever; holy and reverend is his Name.
111:10 The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom; *
      a good understanding have all they that do thereafter; the praise of it endures for ever.

text.NRSV:
112:1 Praise the Lord! Happy are those who fear the Lord, who greatly delight in his commandments.
112:2 Their descendants will be mighty in the land; the generation of the upright will be blessed.
112:3 Wealth and riches are in their houses, and their righteousness endures forever.
112:4 They rise in the darkness as a light for the upright; they are gracious, merciful, and righteous.
112:5 It is well with those who deal generously and lend, who conduct their affairs with justice.
112:6 For the righteous will never be moved; they will be remembered forever.
112:7 They are not afraid of evil tidings; their hearts are firm, secure in the Lord.
112:8 Their hearts are steady, they will not be afraid; in the end they will look in triumph on their foes.
112:9 They have distributed freely, they have given to the poor; their righteousness endures forever; their horn is exalted in honor.
112:10 The wicked see it and are angry; they gnash their teeth and melt away; the desire of the wicked comes to nothing.
text.Coverdale:
112:1 Blessed is the man that fears the LORD; *
      he has great delight in his commandments.
112:2 His seed shall be mighty upon earth; *
      the generation of the faithful shall be blessed.
112:3 Riches and plenteousness shall be in his house; *
      and his righteousness endures for ever.
112:4 Unto the godly there arises up light in the darkness; *
      he is merciful, loving, and righteous.
112:5 A good man is merciful, and lends; *
      and will guide his words with discretion.
112:6 For he shall never be moved; *
      and the righteous shall be had in everlasting remembrance.
112:7 He will not be afraid of any evil tidings; *
      for his heart stands fast, and believes in the LORD.
112:8 His heart is stablished, and will not shrink, *
      until he see his desire upon his enemies.
112:9 He has dispersed abroad, and given to the poor, *
      and his righteousness remains for ever; his horn shall be exalted with honor.
112:10 The ungodly shall see it, and it shall grieve him; *
      he shall gnash with his teeth, and consume away; the desire of the ungodly shall perish.

text.NRSV:
113:1 Praise the Lord! Praise, O servants of the Lord; praise the name of the Lord.
113:2 Blessed be the name of the Lord from this time forth and forevermore.
113:3 From the rising of the sun to its setting the name of the Lord is to be praised.
113:4 The Lord is high above all nations, and his glory above the heavens.
113:5 Who is like the Lord our God, who is seated on high,
113:6 who looks far down on the heavens and the earth?
113:7 He raises the poor from the dust, and lifts the needy from the ash heap,
113:8 to make them sit with princes, with the princes of his people.
113:9 He gives the barren woman a home, making her the joyous mother of children. Praise the Lord!
text.Coverdale:
113:1 Praise the LORD, you servants; *
      O praise the Name of the LORD.
113:2 Blessed be the Name of the LORD, *
      from this time forth for evermore.
113:3 The LORD's Name is praised, *
      from the rising up of the sun unto the going down of the same.
113:4 The LORD is high above all heathen, *
      and his glory above the heavens.
113:5 Who is like unto the LORD our God, that has his dwelling so high, *
      and yet humbles himself to behold the things that are in heaven and earth?
113:6 He takes up the simple out of the dust, *
      and lifts the poor out of the mire;
113:7 That he may set him with the princes, *
      even with the princes of his people.
113:8 He makes the barren woman to keep house, *
      and to be a joyful mother of children.

text.NRSV:
114:1 When Israel went out from Egypt, the house of Jacob from a people of strange language,
114:2 Judah became God's sanctuary, Israel his dominion.
114:3 The sea looked and fled; Jordan turned back.
114:4 The mountains skipped like rams, the hills like lambs.
114:5 Why is it, O sea, that you flee? O Jordan, that you turn back?
114:6 O mountains, that you skip like rams? O hills, like lambs?
114:7 Tremble, O earth, at the presence of the Lord, at the presence of the God of Jacob,
114:8 who turns the rock into a pool of water, the flint into a spring of water.
text.Coverdale:
114:1 When Israel came out of Egypt, *
      and the house of Jacob from among the strange people,
114:2 Judah was his sanctuary, *
      and Israel his dominion.
114:3 The sea saw that, and fled; *
      Jordan was driven back.
114:4 The mountains skipped like rams, *
      and the little hills like young sheep.
114:5 What ailed you, O sea, that you fled? *
      and you Jordan, that you were driven back?
114:6 You mountains, that you skipped like rams? *
      and you little hills, like young sheep?
114:7 Tremble, you earth, at the presence of the Lord, *
      at the presence of the God of Jacob;
114:8 Who turned the hard rock into a standing water, *
      and the flint-stone into a springing well.

text.NRSV:
115:1 Not to us, O Lord, not to us, but to your name give glory, for the sake of your steadfast love and your faithfulness.
115:2 Why should the nations say, 'Where is their God?'
115:3 Our God is in the heavens; he does whatever he pleases.
115:4 Their idols are silver and gold, the work of human hands.
115:5 They have mouths, but do not speak; eyes, but do not see.
115:6 They have ears, but do not hear; noses, but do not smell.
115:7 They have hands, but do not feel; feet, but do not walk; they make no sound in their throats.
115:8 Those who make them are like them; so are all who trust in them.
115:9 O Israel, trust in the Lord! He is their help and their shield.
115:10 O house of Aaron, trust in the Lord! He is their help and their shield.
115:11 You who fear the Lord, trust in the Lord! He is their help and their shield.
115:12 The Lord has been mindful of us; he will bless us; he will bless the house of Israel; he will bless the house of Aaron;
115:13 he will bless those who fear the Lord, both small and great.
115:14 May the Lord give you increase, both you and your children.
115:15 May you be blessed by the Lord, who made heaven and earth.
115:16 The heavens are the Lord's heavens, but the earth he has given to human beings.
115:17 The dead do not praise the Lord, nor do any that go down into silence.
115:18 But we will bless the Lord from this time forth and forevermore. Praise the Lord!
text.Coverdale:
115:1 Not unto us, O LORD, not unto us, but unto your Name give the praise; *
      for your loving mercy, and for your truth's sake.
115:2 Wherefore shall the heathen say, *
      "Where is now their God?"
115:3 As for our God, he is in heaven; *
      he has done whatsoever pleased him.
115:4 Their idols are silver and gold, *
      even the work of men's hands.
115:5 They have mouths, and speak not; *
      eyes have they, and see not.
115:6 They have ears, and hear not; *
      noses have they, and smell not.
115:7 They have hands, and handle not; feet have they, and walk not; *
      neither speak they through their throat.
115:8 They that make them are like unto them; *
      and so are all such as put their trust in them.
115:9 But you, house of Israel, trust you in the LORD; *
      he is their succor and defense.
115:10 You house of Aaron, put your trust in the LORD; *
      he is their helper and defender.
115:11 You that fear the LORD, put your trust in the LORD; *
      he is their helper and defender.
115:12 The LORD has been mindful of us, and he shall bless us; *
      even he shall bless the house of Israel, he shall bless the house of Aaron.
115:13 He shall bless them that fear the LORD, *
      both small and great.
115:14 The LORD shall increase you more and more, *
      you and your children.
115:15 You are the blessed of the LORD, *
      who made heaven and earth.
115:16 All the whole heavens are the LORD's; *
      the earth has he given to the children of men.
115:17 The dead praise not you, O LORD, *
      neither all they that go down into silence.
115:18 But we will praise the LORD, *
      from this time forth for evermore. Praise the LORD.

text.NRSV:
116:1 I love the Lord, because he has heard my voice and my supplications.
116:2 Because he inclined his ear to me, therefore I will call on him as long as I live.
116:3 The snares of death encompassed me; the pangs of Sheol laid hold on me; I suffered distress and anguish.
116:4 Then I called on the name of the Lord: 'O Lord, I pray, save my life!'
116:5 Gracious is the Lord, and righteous; our God is merciful.
116:6 The Lord protects the simple; when I was brought low, he saved me.
116:7 Return, O my soul, to your rest, for the Lord has dealt bountifully with you.
116:8 For you have delivered my soul from death, my eyes from tears, my feet from stumbling.
116:9 I walk before the Lord in the land of the living.
116:10 I kept my faith, even when I said, 'I am greatly afflicted';
116:11 I said in my consternation, 'Everyone is a liar.'
116:12 What shall I return to the Lord for all his bounty to me?
116:13 I will lift up the cup of salvation and call on the name of the Lord,
116:14 I will pay my vows to the Lord in the presence of all his people.
116:15 Precious in the sight of the Lord is the death of his faithful ones.
116:16 O Lord, I am your servant; I am your servant, the child of your serving girl. You have loosed my bonds.
116:17 I will offer to you a thanksgiving sacrifice and call on the name of the Lord.
116:18 I will pay my vows to the Lord in the presence of all his people,
116:19 in the courts of the house of the Lord, in your midst, O Jerusalem. Praise the Lord!
text.Coverdale:
116:1 I am well pleased, *
      that the LORD has heard the voice of my prayer;
116:2 That he has inclined his ear unto me; *
      therefore will I call upon him as long as I live.
116:3 The snares of death compassed me round about, *
      and the pains of hell gat hold upon me.
116:4 I shall find trouble and heaviness, and I will call upon the Name of the LORD; *
      "O LORD, I beseech you, deliver my soul."
116:5 Gracious is the LORD, and righteous; *
      yea, our God is merciful.
116:6 The LORD preserves the simple; *
      I was in misery, and he helped me.
116:7 Turn again then unto your rest, O my soul; *
      for the LORD has rewarded you.
116:8 And why? you have delivered my soul from death, *
      my eyes from tears, and my feet from falling.
116:9 I will walk before the LORD *
      in the land of the living.
116:10 I believed, and therefore will I speak; but I was sore troubled; *
      I said in my haste, "All men are liars."
116:11 What reward shall I give unto the LORD *
      for all the benefits that he has done unto me?
116:12 I will receive the cup of salvation, *
      and call upon the Name of the LORD.
116:13 I will pay my vows now in the presence of all his people; *
      right dear in the sight of the LORD is the death of his saints.
116:14 Behold, O LORD, how that I am your servant; *
      I am your servant, and the son of your handmaid; you have broken my bonds in sunder.
116:15 I will offer to you the sacrifice of thanksgiving, *
      and will call upon the Name of the LORD.
116:16 I will pay my vows unto the LORD, in the sight of all his people, *
      in the courts of the LORD's house, even in the midst of you, O Jerusalem. Praise the LORD.

text.NRSV:
117:1 Praise the Lord, all you nations! Extol him, all you peoples!
117:2 For great is his steadfast love toward us, and the faithfulness of the Lord endures forever. Praise the Lord!
text.Coverdale:
117:1 O praise the LORD, all you heathen; *
      praise him, all you nations.
117:2 For his merciful kindness is ever more and more towards us; *
      and the truth of the LORD endures for ever. Praise the LORD.

text.NRSV:
118:1 O give thanks to the Lord, for he is good; his steadfast love endures forever!
118:2 Let Israel say, 'His steadfast love endures forever.'
118:3 Let the house of Aaron say, 'His steadfast love endures forever.'
118:4 Let those who fear the Lord say, 'His steadfast love endures forever.'
118:5 Out of my distress I called on the Lord; the Lord answered me and set me in a broad place.
118:6 With the Lord on my side I do not fear. What can mortals do to me?
118:7 The Lord is on my side to help me; I shall look in triumph on those who hate me.
118:8 It is better to take refuge in the Lord than to put confidence in mortals.
118:9 It is better to take refuge in the Lord than to put confidence in princes.
118:10 All nations surrounded me; in the name of the Lord I cut them off!
118:11 They surrounded me, surrounded me on every side; in the name of the Lord I cut them off!
118:12 They surrounded me like bees; they blazed like a fire of thorns; in the name of the Lord I cut them off!
118:13 I was pushed hard, so that I was falling, but the Lord helped me.
118:14 The Lord is my strength and my might; he has become my salvation.
118:15 There are glad songs of victory in the tents of the righteous: 'The right hand of the Lord does valiantly;
118:16 the right hand of the Lord is exalted; the right hand of the Lord does valiantly.'
118:17 I shall not die, but I shall live, and recount the deeds of the Lord.
118:18 The Lord has punished me severely, but he did not give me over to death.
118:19 Open to me the gates of righteousness, that I may enter through them and give thanks to the Lord.
118:20 This is the gate of the Lord; the righteous shall enter through it.
118:21 I thank you that you have answered me and have become my salvation.
118:22 The stone that the builders rejected has become the chief cornerstone.
118:23 This is the Lord's doing; it is marvelous in our eyes.
118:24 This is the day that the Lord has made; let us rejoice and be glad in it.
118:25 Save us, we beseech you, O Lord! O Lord, we beseech you, give us success!
118:26 Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord. We bless you from the house of the Lord.
118:27 The Lord is God, and he has given us light. Bind the festal procession with branches, up to the horns of the altar.
118:28 You are my God, and I will give thanks to you; you are my God, I will extol you.
118:29 O give thanks to the Lord, for he is good, for his steadfast love endures forever.
text.Coverdale:
118:1 O give thanks unto the LORD, for he is gracious; *
      because his mercy endures for ever.
118:2 Let Israel now confess that he is gracious, *
      and that his mercy endures for ever.
118:3 Let the house of Aaron now confess, *
      that his mercy endures for ever.
118:4 Yea, let them now that fear the LORD confess, *
      that his mercy endures for ever.
118:5 I called upon the LORD in trouble; *
      and the LORD heard me at large.
118:6 The LORD is on my side; *
      I will not fear what man does unto me.
118:7 The LORD takes my part with them that help me; *
      therefore shall I see my desire upon mine enemies.
118:8 It is better to trust in the LORD, *
      than to put any confidence in man.
118:9 It is better to trust in the LORD, *
      than to put any confidence in princes.
118:10 All nations compassed me round about; *
      but in the Name of the LORD will I destroy them.
118:11 They kept me in on every side, they kept me in, I say, on every side; *
      but in the Name of the LORD will I destroy them.
118:12 They came about me like bees, and are extinct even as the fire among the thorns; *
      for in the Name of the LORD I will destroy them.
118:13 You have thrust sore at me, that I might fall; *
      but the LORD was my help.
118:14 The LORD is my strength, and my song; *
      and is become my salvation.
118:15 The voice of joy and health is in the dwellings of the righteous; *
      the right hand of the LORD brings mighty things to pass.
118:16 The right hand of the LORD has the pre-eminence; *
      the right hand of the LORD brings mighty things to pass.
118:17 I shall not die, but live, *
      and declare the works of the LORD.
118:18 The LORD has chastened and corrected me; *
      but he has not given me over unto death.
118:19 Open me the gates of righteousness, *
      that I may go into them, and give thanks unto the LORD.
118:20 This is the gate of the LORD; *
      the righteous shall enter into it.
118:21 I will thank you, for you have heard me, *
      and are become my salvation.
118:22 The same stone which the builders refused, *
      is become the head-stone in the corner.
118:23 This is the LORD's doing, *
      and it is marvelous in our eyes.
118:24 This is the day which the LORD has made; *
      we will rejoice and be glad in it.
118:25 Help me now, O LORD; *
      O LORD, send us now prosperity.
118:26 Blessed is he that comes in the Name of the LORD; *
      we have wished you good luck, you that are of the house of the LORD.
118:27 God is the LORD, who has showed us light; *
      bind the sacrifice with cords, yea, even unto the horns of the altar.
118:28 You are my God, and I will thank you; *
      you are my God, and I will praise you.
118:29 O give thanks unto the LORD, for he is gracious; *
      and his mercy endures for ever.

text.NRSV:
119:1 Happy are those whose way is blameless, who walk in the law of the Lord.
119:2 Happy are those who keep his decrees, who seek him with their whole heart,
119:3 who also do no wrong, but walk in his ways.
119:4 You have commanded your precepts to be kept diligently.
119:5 O that my ways may be steadfast in keeping your statutes!
119:6 Then I shall not be put to shame, having my eyes fixed on all your commandments.
119:7 I will praise you with an upright heart, when I learn your righteous ordinances.
119:8 I will observe your statutes; do not utterly forsake me.
119:9 How can young people keep their way pure? By guarding it according to your word.
119:10 With my whole heart I seek you; do not let me stray from your commandments.
119:11 I treasure your word in my heart, so that I may not sin against you.
119:12 Blessed are you, O Lord; teach me your statutes.
119:13 With my lips I declare all the ordinances of your mouth.
119:14 I delight in the way of your decrees as much as in all riches.
119:15 I will meditate on your precepts, and fix my eyes on your ways.
119:16 I will delight in your statutes; I will not forget your word.
119:17 Deal bountifully with your servant, so that I may live and observe your word.
119:18 Open my eyes, so that I may behold wondrous things out of your law.
119:19 I am a stranger in the earth; do not hide your commandments from me.
119:20 My soul is consumed with longing for your ordinances at all times.
119:21 You rebuke the insolent, accursed ones, who stray from your commandments;
119:22 take away from me their scorn and contempt, for I have kept your decrees.
119:23 Even though princes sit plotting against me, your servant will meditate on your statutes.
119:24 Your decrees are my delight, they are my counselors.
119:25 My soul clings to the dust; revive me according to your word.
119:26 When I told of my ways, you answered me; teach me your statutes.
119:27 Make me understand the way of your precepts, and I will meditate on your wondrous works.
119:28 My soul melts away for sorrow; strengthen me according to your word.
119:29 Put false ways far from me; and graciously teach me your law.
119:30 I have chosen the way of faithfulness; I set your ordinances before me.
119:31 I cling to your decrees, O Lord; let me not be put to shame.
119:32 I run the way of your commandments, for you enlarge my understanding.
119:33 Teach me, O Lord, the way of your statutes, and I will observe it to the end.
119:34 Give me understanding, that I may keep your law and observe it with my whole heart.
119:35 Lead me in the path of your commandments, for I delight in it.
119:36 Turn my heart to your decrees, and not to selfish gain.
119:37 Turn my eyes from looking at vanities; give me life in your ways.
119:38 Confirm to your servant your promise, which is for those who fear you.
119:39 Turn away the disgrace that I dread, for your ordinances are good.
119:40 See, I have longed for your precepts; in your righteousness give me life.
119:41 Let your steadfast love come to me, O Lord, your salvation according to your promise;
119:42 then I shall have an answer for those who taunt me, for I trust in your word.
119:43 Do not take the word of truth utterly out of my mouth, for my hope is in your ordinances.
119:44 I will keep your law continually, forever and ever.
119:45 I shall walk at liberty, for I have sought your precepts.
119:46 I will also speak of your decrees before kings, and shall not be put to shame;
119:47 I find my delight in your commandments, because I love them.
119:48 I revere your commandments, which I love, and I will meditate on your statutes.
119:49 Remember your word to your servant, in which you have made me hope.
119:50 This is my comfort in my distress, that your promise gives me life.
119:51 The arrogant utterly deride me, but I do not turn away from your law.
119:52 When I think of your ordinances from of old, I take comfort, O Lord.
119:53 Hot indignation seizes me because of the wicked, those who forsake your law.
119:54 Your statutes have been my songs wherever I make my home.
119:55 I remember your name in the night, O Lord, and keep your law.
119:56 This blessing has fallen to me, for I have kept your precepts.
119:57 The Lord is my portion; I promise to keep your words.
119:58 I implore your favor with all my heart; be gracious to me according to your promise.
119:59 When I think of your ways, I turn my feet to your decrees;
119:60 I hurry and do not delay to keep your commandments.
119:61 Though the cords of the wicked ensnare me, I do not forget your law.
119:62 At midnight I rise to praise you, because of your righteous ordinances.
119:63 I am a companion of all who fear you, of those who keep your precepts.
119:64 The earth, O Lord, is full of your steadfast love; teach me your statutes.
119:65 You have dealt well with your servant, O Lord, according to your word.
119:66 Teach me good judgment and knowledge, for I believe in your commandments.
119:67 Before I was humbled I went astray, but now I keep your word.
119:68 You are good and do good; teach me your statutes.
119:69 The arrogant smear me with lies, but with my whole heart I keep your precepts.
119:70 Their hearts are fat and gross, but I delight in your law.
119:71 It was good for me that I was humbled, so that I might learn your statutes.
119:72 The law of your mouth is better to me than thousands of gold and silver pieces.
119:73 Your hands have made and fashioned me; give me understanding that I may learn your commandments.
119:74 Those who fear you shall see me and rejoice, because I have hoped in your word.
119:75 I know, O Lord, that your judgments are right, and that in faithfulness you have humbled me.
119:76 Let your steadfast love become my comfort according to your promise to your servant.
119:77 Let your mercy come to me, that I may live; for your law is my delight.
119:78 Let the arrogant be put to shame, because they have subverted me with guile; as for me, I will meditate on your precepts.
119:79 Let those who fear you turn to me, so that they may know your decrees.
119:80 May my heart be blameless in your statutes, so that I may not be put to shame.
119:81 My soul languishes for your salvation; I hope in your word.
119:82 My eyes fail with watching for your promise; I ask, 'When will you comfort me?'
119:83 For I have become like a wineskin in the smoke, yet I have not forgotten your statutes.
119:84 How long must your servant endure? When will you judge those who persecute me?
119:85 The arrogant have dug pitfalls for me; they flout your law.
119:86 All your commandments are enduring; I am persecuted without cause; help me!
119:87 They have almost made an end of me on earth; but I have not forsaken your precepts.
119:88 In your steadfast love spare my life, so that I may keep the decrees of your mouth.
119:89 The Lord exists forever; your word is firmly fixed in heaven.
119:90 Your faithfulness endures to all generations; you have established the earth, and it stands fast.
119:91 By your appointment they stand today, for all things are your servants.
119:92 If your law had not been my delight, I would have perished in my misery.
119:93 I will never forget your precepts, for by them you have given me life.
119:94 I am yours; save me, for I have sought your precepts.
119:95 The wicked lie in wait to destroy me, but I consider your decrees.
119:96 I have seen a limit to all perfection, but your commandment is exceedingly broad.
119:97 Oh, how I love your law! It is my meditation all day long.
119:98 Your commandment makes me wiser than my enemies, for it is always with me.
119:99 I have more understanding than all my teachers, for your decrees are my meditation.
119:100 I understand more than the aged, for I keep your precepts.
119:101 I hold back my feet from every evil way, in order to keep your word.
119:102 I do not turn away from your ordinances, for you have taught me.
119:103 How sweet are your words to my taste, sweeter than honey to my mouth!
119:104 Through your precepts I get understanding; therefore I hate every false way.
119:105 Your word is a lamp to my feet and a light to my path.
119:106 I have sworn an oath and confirmed it, to observe your righteous ordinances.
119:107 I am severely afflicted; give me life, O Lord, according to your word.
119:108 Accept my offerings of praise, O Lord, and teach me your ordinances.
119:109 I hold my life in my hand continually, but I do not forget your law.
119:110 The wicked have laid a snare for me, but I do not stray from your precepts.
119:111 Your decrees are my heritage forever; they are the joy of my heart.
119:112 I incline my heart to perform your statutes forever, to the end.
119:113 I hate the double-minded, but I love your law.
119:114 You are my hiding place and my shield; I hope in your word.
119:115 Go away from me, you evildoers, that I may keep the commandments of my God.
119:116 Uphold me according to your promise, that I may live, and let me not be put to shame in my hope.
119:117 Hold me up, that I may be safe and have regard for your statutes continually.
119:118 You spurn all who go astray from your statutes; for their cunning is in vain.
119:119 All the wicked of the earth you count as dross; therefore I love your decrees.
119:120 My flesh trembles for fear of you, and I am afraid of your judgments.
119:121 I have done what is just and right; do not leave me to my oppressors.
119:122 Guarantee your servant's well-being; do not let the arrogant oppress me.
119:123 My eyes fail from watching for your salvation, and for the fulfillment of your righteous promise.
119:124 Deal with your servant according to your steadfast love, and teach me your statutes.
119:125 I am your servant; give me understanding, so that I may know your decrees.
119:126 It is time for the Lord to act, for your law has been broken.
119:127 Truly I love your commandments more than gold, more than fine gold.
119:128 Truly I direct my steps by all your precepts; I hate every false way.
119:129 Your decrees are wonderful; therefore my soul keeps them.
119:130 The unfolding of your words gives light; it imparts understanding to the simple.
119:131 I open my mouth and pant, because I long for your commandments.
119:132 Turn to me and be gracious to me, as is your custom toward those who love your name.
119:133 Keep my steps steady according to your promise, and never let iniquity have dominion over me.
119:134 Redeem me from human oppression, that I may keep your precepts.
119:135 Make your face shine upon your servant, and teach me your statutes.
119:136 My eyes shed streams of tears because your law is not kept.
119:137 You are righteous, O Lord, and your judgments are right.
119:138 You have appointed your decrees in righteousness and in all faithfulness.
119:139 My zeal consumes me because my foes forget your words.
119:140 Your promise is well tried, and your servant loves it.
119:141 I am small and despised, yet I do not forget your precepts.
119:142 Your righteousness is an everlasting righteousness, and your law is the truth.
119:143 Trouble and anguish have come upon me, but your commandments are my delight.
119:144 Your decrees are righteous forever; give me understanding that I may live.
119:145 With my whole heart I cry; answer me, O Lord. I will keep your statutes.
119:146 I cry to you; save me, that I may observe your decrees.
119:147 I rise before dawn and cry for help; I hope in your words.
119:148 My eyes are awake before each watch of the night, that I may meditate on your promise.
119:149 In your steadfast love hear my voice; O Lord, in your justice preserve my life.
119:150 Those who persecute me with evil purpose draw near; they are far from your law.
119:151 Yet you are near, O Lord, and all your commandments are true.
119:152 Long ago I learned from your decrees that you have established them forever.
119:153 Look on my misery and rescue me, for I do not forget your law.
119:154 Plead my cause and redeem me; give me life according to your promise.
119:155 Salvation is far from the wicked, for they do not seek your statutes.
119:156 Great is your mercy, O Lord; give me life according to your justice.
119:157 Many are my persecutors and my adversaries, yet I do not swerve from your decrees.
119:158 I look at the faithless with disgust, because they do not keep your commands.
119:159 Consider how I love your precepts; preserve my life according to your steadfast love.
119:160 The sum of your word is truth; and every one of your righteous ordinances endures forever.
119:161 Princes persecute me without cause, but my heart stands in awe of your words.
119:162 I rejoice at your word like one who finds great spoil.
119:163 I hate and abhor falsehood, but I love your law.
119:164 Seven times a day I praise you for your righteous ordinances.
119:165 Great peace have those who love your law; nothing can make them stumble.
119:166 I hope for your salvation, O Lord, and I fulfill your commandments.
119:167 My soul keeps your decrees; I love them exceedingly.
119:168 I keep your precepts and decrees, for all my ways are before you.
119:169 Let my cry come before you, O Lord; give me understanding according to your word.
119:170 Let my supplication come before you; deliver me according to your promise.
119:171 My lips shall pour forth praise, because you teach me your statutes.
119:172 My tongue shall sing of your promise, for all your commandments are right.
119:173 Let your hand be ready to help me, for I have chosen your precepts.
119:174 I long for your salvation, O Lord, and your law is my delight.
119:175 Let me live that I may praise you, and let your ordinances help me.
119:176 I have gone astray like a lost sheep; seek out your servant, for I do not forget your commandments.
text.Coverdale:
119:1 Blessed are those who are undefiled in the way, *
      and walk in the law of the LORD.
119:2 Blessed are they that keep his testimonies, *
      and seek him with their whole heart.
119:3 For they who do no wickedness *
      walk in his ways.
119:4 You have charged *
      that we shall diligently keep your commandments.
119:5 O that my ways were made so direct, *
      that I might keep your statutes!
119:6 So shall I not be confounded, *
      while I have respect unto all your commandments.
119:7 I will thank you with an unfeigned heart, *
      when I shall have learned the judgments of your righteousness.
119:8 I will keep your ceremonies; *
      O forsake me not utterly.
119:9 Wherewithal shall a young man cleanse his way? *
      even by ruling himself after your word.
119:10 With my whole heart have I sought you; *
      O let me not go wrong out of your commandments.
119:11 Your words have I hid within my heart, *
      that I should not sin against you.
119:12 Blessed are you, O LORD; *
      O teach me your statutes.
119:13 With my lips have I been telling *
      of all the judgments of your mouth.
119:14 I have had as great delight in the way of your testimonies, *
      as in all manner of riches.
119:15 I will talk of your commandments, *
      and have respect unto your ways.
119:16 My delight shall be in your statutes, *
      and I will not forget your word.
119:17 O do well unto your servant, *
      that I may live, and keep your word.
119:18 Open you mine eyes, *
      that I may see the wondrous things of your law.
119:19 I am a stranger upon earth; *
      O hide not your commandments from me.
119:20 My soul breaks out for the very fervent desire *
      that it has alway unto your judgments.
119:21 You have rebuked the proud; *
      and cursed are they that do err from your commandments.
119:22 O turn from me shame and rebuke; *
      for I have kept your testimonies.
119:23 Princes also did sit and speak against me; *
      but your servant is occupied in your statutes.
119:24 For your testimonies are my delight, *
      and my counsellors.
119:25 My soul cleaves to the dust; *
      O quicken you me, according to your word.
119:26 I have acknowledged my ways, and you heard me; *
      O teach me your statutes.
119:27 Make me to understand the way of your commandments; *
      and so shall I talk of your wondrous works.
119:28 My soul melts away for very heaviness; *
      comfort you me according unto your word.
119:29 Take from me the way of lying, *
      and cause you me to make much of your law.
119:30 I have chosen the way of truth, *
      and your judgments have I laid before me.
119:31 I have stuck unto your testimonies; *
      O LORD, confound me not.
119:32 I will run the way of your commandments, *
      when you have set my heart at liberty.
119:33 Teach me, O LORD, the way of your statutes, *
      and I shall keep it unto the end.
119:34 Give me understanding, and I shall keep your law; *
      yea, I shall keep it with my whole heart.
119:35 Make me to go in the path of your commandments; *
      for therein is my desire.
119:36 Incline my heart unto your testimonies, *
      and not to covetousness.
119:37 O turn away mine eyes, lest they behold vanity; *
      and quicken you me in your way.
119:38 O stablish your word in your servant, *
      that I may fear you.
119:39 Take away the rebuke that I am afraid of; *
      for your judgments are good.
119:40 Behold, my delight is in your commandments; *
      O quicken me in your righteousness.
119:41 Let your loving mercy come also unto me, O LORD, *
      even your salvation, according unto your word.
119:42 So shall I make answer unto my blasphemers; *
      for my trust is in your word.
119:43 O take not the word of truth utterly out of my mouth; *
      for my hope is in your judgments.
119:44 So shall I alway keep your law; *
      yea, for ever and ever.
119:45 And I will walk at liberty; *
      for I seek your commandments.
119:46 I will speak of your testimonies also, even before kings, *
      and will not be ashamed.
119:47 And my delight shall be in your commandments, *
      which I have loved.
119:48 My hands also will I lift up unto your commandments, which I have loved; *
      and my study shall be in your statutes.
119:49 O think upon your servant, as concerning your word, *
      wherein you have caused me to put my trust.
119:50 The same is my comfort in my trouble; *
      for your word has quickened me.
119:51 The proud have had me exceedingly in derision; *
      yet have I not shrinked from your law.
119:52 For I remembered your judgments of old, O LORD, *
      and received comfort.
119:53 I am horribly afraid, *
      for the ungodly that forsake your law.
119:54 Your statutes have been my songs, *
      in the house of my pilgrimage.
119:55 I have thought upon your Name, O LORD, in the night-season, *
      and have kept your law.
119:56 This I had, *
      because I kept your commandments.
119:57 You are my portion, O LORD; *
      I have promised to keep your law.
119:58 I made my humble petition in your presence with my whole heart; *
      O be merciful unto me, according to your word.
119:59 I called mine own ways to remembrance, *
      and turned my feet unto your testimonies.
119:60 I made haste, and prolonged not the time, *
      to keep your commandments.
119:61 The snares of the ungodly have compassed me about; *
      but I have not forgotten your law.
119:62 At midnight I will rise to give thanks unto you, *
      because of your righteous judgments.
119:63 I am a companion of all them that fear you, *
      and keep your commandments.
119:64 The earth, O LORD, is full of your mercy; *
      O teach me your statutes.
119:65 O LORD, you have dealt graciously with your servant, *
      according unto your word.
119:66 O learn me true understanding and knowledge; *
      for I have believed your commandments.
119:67 Before I was troubled, I went wrong; *
      but now have I kept your word.
119:68 You are good and gracious; *
      O teach me your statutes.
119:69 The proud have imagined a lie against me; *
      but I will keep your commandments with my whole heart.
119:70 Their heart is as fat as brawn; *
      but my delight has been in your law.
119:71 It is good for me that I have been in trouble, *
      that I may learn your statutes.
119:72 The law of your mouth is dearer unto me *
      than thousands of gold and silver.
119:73 Your hands have made me and fashioned me; *
      O give me understanding, that I may learn your commandments.
119:74 They that fear you will be glad when they see me; *
      because I have put my trust in your word.
119:75 I know, O LORD, that your judgments are right, *
      and that you of very faithfulness have caused me to be troubled.
119:76 O let your merciful kindness be my comfort, *
      according to your word unto your servant.
119:77 O let your loving mercies come unto me, that I may live; *
      for your law is my delight.
119:78 Let the proud be confounded, for they go wickedly about to destroy me; *
      but I will be occupied in your commandments.
119:79 Let such as fear you, and have known your testimonies, *
      be turned unto me.
119:80 O let my heart be sound in your statutes, *
      that I be not ashamed.
119:81 My soul has longed for your salvation, *
      and I have a good hope because of your word.
119:82 My eyes long sore for your word, *
      saying, "O when will you comfort me?"
119:83 For I am become like a bottle in the smoke; *
      yet do I not forget your statutes.
119:84 How many are the days of your servant? *
      when will you be avenged of them that persecute me?
119:85 The proud have digged pits for me, *
      which are not after your law.
119:86 All your commandments are true; *
      they persecute me falsely; O be you my help.
119:87 They had almost made an end of me upon earth; *
      but I forsook not your commandments.
119:88 O quicken me after your loving-kindness; *
      and so shall I keep the testimonies of your mouth.
119:89 O LORD, your word *
      endures for ever in heaven.
119:90 Your truth also remains from one generation to another; *
      you have laid the foundation of the earth, and it abides.
119:91 They continue this day according to your ordinance; *
      for all things serve you.
119:92 If my delight had not been in your law, *
      I should have perished in my trouble.
119:93 I will never forget your commandments; *
      for with them you have quickened me.
119:94 I am yours, O save me; *
      for I have sought your commandments.
119:95 The ungodly laid wait for me to destroy me; *
      but I will consider your testimonies.
119:96 I see that all things come to an end; *
      but your commandment is exceeding broad.
119:97 Lord, what love have I unto your law! *
      all the day long is my study in it.
119:98 You through your commandments have made me wiser than mine enemies; *
      for they are ever with me.
119:99 I have more understanding than my teachers; *
      for your testimonies are my study.
119:100 I am wiser than the aged; *
      because I keep your commandments.
119:101 I have refrained my feet from every evil way, *
      that I may keep your word.
119:102 I have not shrunk from your judgments; *
      for you teach me.
119:103 O how sweet are your words unto my throat! *
      yea, sweeter than honey unto my mouth.
119:104 Through your commandments I get understanding; *
      therefore I hate all evil ways.
119:105 Your word is a lantern unto my feet, *
      and a light unto my paths.
119:106 I have sworn, and am stedfastly purposed, *
      to keep your righteous judgments.
119:107 I am troubled above measure; *
      quicken me, O LORD, according to your word.
119:108 Let the free-will offerings of my mouth please you, O LORD; *
      and teach me your judgments.
119:109 My soul is alway in my hand; *
      yet do I not forget your law.
119:110 The ungodly have laid a snare for me; *
      but yet I swerved not from your commandments.
119:111 Your testimonies have I claimed as mine heritage for ever; *
      and why? they are the very joy of my heart.
119:112 I have applied my heart to fulfill your statutes alway, *
      even unto the end.
119:113 I hate them that imagine evil things; *
      but your law do I love.
119:114 You are my defense and shield; *
      and my trust is in your word.
119:115 Away from me, you wicked; *
      I will keep the commandments of my God.
119:116 O stablish me according to your word, that I may live; *
      and let me not be disappointed of my hope.
119:117 Hold you me up, and I shall be safe; *
      yea, my delight shall be ever in your statutes.
119:118 You have trodden down all them that depart from your statutes; *
      for they imagine but deceit.
119:119 You put away all the ungodly of the earth like dross; *
      therefore I love your testimonies.
119:120 My flesh trembles for fear of you; *
      and I am afraid of your judgments.
119:121 I deal with the thing that is lawful and right; *
      O give me not over unto mine oppressors.
119:122 Make you your servant to delight in that which is good, *
      that the proud do me no wrong.
119:123 My eyes are wasted away with looking for your health, *
      and for the word of your righteousness.
119:124 O deal with your servant according unto your loving mercy, *
      and teach me your statutes.
119:125 I am your servant, O grant me understanding, *
      that I may know your testimonies.
119:126 It is time for you, LORD, to lay to your hand; *
      for they have destroyed your law.
119:127 For I love your commandments *
      above gold and precious stone.
119:128 Therefore hold I straight all your commandments; *
      and all false ways I utterly abhor.
119:129 Your testimonies are wonderful; *
      therefore does my soul keep them.
119:130 When your word goes forth, *
      it gives light and understanding unto the simple.
119:131 I opened my mouth, and drew in my breath; *
      for my delight was in your commandments.
119:132 O look you upon me, and be merciful unto me, *
      as you usest to do unto those who love your Name.
119:133 Order my steps in your word; *
      and so shall no wickedness have dominion over me.
119:134 O deliver me from the wrongful dealings of men; *
      and so shall I keep your commandments.
119:135 Show the light of your countenance upon your servant, *
      and teach me your statutes.
119:136 My eyes gush out with water, *
      because men keep not your law.
119:137 Righteous are you, O LORD; *
      and true is your judgment.
119:138 The testimonies that you have commanded *
      are exceeding righteous and true.
119:139 My zeal has even consumed me; *
      because mine enemies have forgotten your words.
119:140 Your word is tried to the uttermost, *
      and your servant loves it.
119:141 I am small, and of no reputation; *
      yet do I not forget your commandments.
119:142 Your righteousness is an everlasting righteousness, *
      and your law is the truth.
119:143 Trouble and heaviness have taken hold upon me; *
      yet is my delight in your commandments.
119:144 The righteousness of your testimonies is everlasting; *
      O grant me understanding, and I shall live.
119:145 I call with my whole heart; *
      hear me, O LORD, I will keep your statutes.
119:146 Yea, even unto you do I call; *
      help me, and I shall keep your testimonies.
119:147 Early in the morning do I cry unto you; *
      for in your word is my trust.
119:148 My eyes prevent the night-watches, *
      that I might be occupied in your words.
119:149 Hear my voice, O LORD, according unto your loving-kindness; *
      quicken me, according as you are wont.
119:150 They draw nigh that of malice persecute me, *
      and are far from your law.
119:151 Be you nigh at hand, O LORD; *
      for all your commandments are true.
119:152 As concerning your testimonies, I have known long since, *
      that you have grounded them for ever.
119:153 O consider my adversity, and deliver me; *
      for I do not forget your law.
119:154 Avenge you my cause, and deliver me; *
      quicken me, according to your word.
119:155 Health is far from the ungodly; *
      for they regard not your statutes.
119:156 Great is your mercy, O LORD; *
      quicken me, as you are wont.
119:157 Many there are that trouble me, and persecute me; *
      yet do I not swerve from your testimonies.
119:158 It pities me when I see the transgressors; *
      because they keep not your law.
119:159 Consider, O LORD, how I love your commandments; *
      O quicken me, according to your loving-kindness.
119:160 Your word is true from everlasting; *
      all the judgments of your righteousness endure for evermore.
119:161 Princes have persecuted me without a cause; *
      but my heart stands in awe of your word.
119:162 I am as glad of your word, *
      as one that finds great spoils.
119:163 As for lies, I hate and abhor them; *
      but your law do I love.
119:164 Seven times a day do I praise you, *
      because of your righteous judgments.
119:165 Great is the peace that they have who love your law; *
      and they are not offended at it.
119:166 LORD, I have looked for your saving health, *
      and done after your commandments.
119:167 My soul has kept your testimonies, *
      and loved them exceedingly.
119:168 I have kept your commandments and testimonies; *
      for all my ways are before you.
119:169 Let my complaint come before you, O LORD; *
      give me understanding, according to your word.
119:170 Let my supplication come before you; *
      deliver me, according to your word.
119:171 My lips shall speak of your praise, *
      when you have taught me your statutes.
119:172 Yea, my tongue shall sing of your word; *
      for all your commandments are righteous.
119:173 Let your hand help me; *
      for I have chosen your commandments.
119:174 I have longed for your saving health, O LORD; *
      and in your law is my delight.
119:175 O let my soul live, and it shall praise you; *
      and your judgments shall help me.
119:176 I have gone astray like a sheep that is lost; *
      O seek your servant, for I do not forget your commandments.

text.NRSV:
120:1 In my distress I cry to the Lord, and he answers me.
120:2 'Deliver me, O Lord, from lying lips, from a deceitful tongue.'
120:3 What shall be given to you? And what more shall be done to you, you deceitful tongue?
120:4 A warrior's sharp arrows, with glowing coals of the broom tree!
120:5 Woe is me, that I am an alien in Meshech, that I must live among the tents of Kedar.
120:6 Too long have I had my dwelling among those who hate peace.
120:7 I am for peace; but when I speak, they are for war.
text.Coverdale:
120:1 When I was in trouble I called upon the LORD, *
      and he heard me.
120:2 Deliver my soul, O LORD, from lying lips, *
      and from a deceitful tongue.
120:3 What reward shall be given or done unto you, you false tongue? *
      even mighty and sharp arrows, with hot burning coals.
120:4 Woe is me, that I am constrained to dwell with Mesech, *
      and to have my habitation among the tents of Kedar.
120:5 My soul has long dwelt among them *
      that are enemies unto peace.
120:6 I labor for peace, but when I speak unto them thereof, *
      they make them ready to battle.

text.NRSV:
121:1 I lift up my eyes to the hills from where will my help come?
121:2 My help comes from the Lord, who made heaven and earth.
121:3 He will not let your foot be moved; he who keeps you will not slumber.
121:4 He who keeps Israel will neither slumber nor sleep.
121:5 The Lord is your keeper; the Lord is your shade at your right hand.
121:6 The sun shall not strike you by day, nor the moon by night.
121:7 The Lord will keep you from all evil; he will keep your life.
121:8 The Lord will keep your going out and your coming in from this time forth and forevermore.
text.Coverdale:
121:1 I will lift up mine eyes unto the hills, *
      from whence comes my help.
121:2 My help comes even from the LORD, *
      who has made heaven and earth.
121:3 He will not suffer your foot to be moved; *
      and he that keeps you will not sleep.
121:4 Behold, he that keeps Israel *
      shall neither slumber nor sleep.
121:5 The LORD himself is your keeper; *
      the LORD is your defense upon your right hand;
121:6 So that the sun shall not burn you by day, *
      neither the moon by night.
121:7 The LORD shall preserve you from all evil; *
      yea, it is even he that shall keep your soul.
121:8 The LORD shall preserve your going out, and your coming in, *
      from this time forth for evermore.

text.NRSV:
122:1 I was glad when they said to me, 'Let us go to the house of the Lord!'
122:2 Our feet are standing within your gates, O Jerusalem.
122:3 Jerusalembuilt as a city that is bound firmly together.
122:4 To it the tribes go up, the tribes of the Lord, as was decreed for Israel, to give thanks to the name of the Lord.
122:5 For there the thrones for judgment were set up, the thrones of the house of David.
122:6 Pray for the peace of Jerusalem: 'May they prosper who love you.
122:7 Peace be within your walls, and security within your towers.'
122:8 For the sake of my relatives and friends I will say, 'Peace be within you.'
122:9 For the sake of the house of the Lord our God, I will seek your good.
text.Coverdale:
122:1 I was glad when they said unto me, *
      "We will go into the house of the LORD."
122:2 Our feet shall stand in your gates, *
      O Jerusalem.
122:3 Jerusalem is built as a city *
      that is at unity in itself.
122:4 For thither the tribes go up, even the tribes of the LORD, *
      to testify unto Israel, to give thanks unto the Name of the LORD.
122:5 For there is the seat of judgment, *
      even the seat of the house of David.
122:6 O pray for the peace of Jerusalem; *
      they shall prosper that love you.
122:7 Peace be within your walls, *
      and plenteousness within your palaces.
122:8 For my brethren and companions' sakes, *
      I will wish you prosperity.
122:9 Yea, because of the house of the LORD our God, *
      I will seek to do you good.

text.NRSV:
123:1 To you I lift up my eyes, O you who are enthroned in the heavens!
123:2 As the eyes of servants look to the hand of their master, as the eyes of a maid to the hand of her mistress, so our eyes look to the Lord our God, until he has mercy upon us.
123:3 Have mercy upon us, O Lord, have mercy upon us, for we have had more than enough of contempt.
123:4 Our soul has had more than its fill of the scorn of those who are at ease, of the contempt of the proud.
text.Coverdale:
123:1 Unto you lift I up mine eyes, *
      O you that dwellest in the heavens.
123:2 Behold, even as the eyes of servants look unto the hand of their masters, and as the eyes of a maiden unto the hand of her mistress, *
      even so our eyes wait upon the LORD our God, until he have mercy upon us.
123:3 Have mercy upon us, O LORD, have mercy upon us; *
      for we are utterly despised.
123:4 Our soul is filled with the scornful reproof of the wealthy, *
      and with the despitefulness of the proud.

text.NRSV:
124:1 If it had not been the Lord who was on our side let Israel now say
124:2 if it had not been the Lord who was on our side, when our enemies attacked us,
124:3 then they would have swallowed us up alive, when their anger was kindled against us;
124:4 then the flood would have swept us away, the torrent would have gone over us;
124:5 then over us would have gone the raging waters.
124:6 Blessed be the Lord, who has not given us as prey to their teeth.
124:7 We have escaped like a bird from the snare of the fowlers; the snare is broken, and we have escaped.
124:8 Our help is in the name of the Lord, who made heaven and earth.
text.Coverdale:
124:1 If the LORD himself had not been on our side, now may Israel say; *
      if the LORD himself had not been on our side, when men rose up against us;
124:2 They had swallowed us up quick, *
      when they were so wrathfully displeased at us.
124:3 Yea, the waters had drowned us, *
      and the stream had gone over our soul.
124:4 The deep waters of the proud *
      had gone even over our soul.
124:5 But praised be the LORD, *
      who has not given us over for a prey unto their teeth.
124:6 Our soul is escaped even as a bird out of the snare of the fowler; *
      the snare is broken, and we are delivered.
124:7 Our help stands in the Name of the LORD, *
      who has made heaven and earth.

text.NRSV:
125:1 Those who trust in the Lord are like Mount Zion, which cannot be moved, but abides forever.
125:2 As the mountains surround Jerusalem, so the Lord surrounds his people, from this time forth and forevermore.
125:3 For the scepter of wickedness shall not rest on the land allotted to the righteous, lest the righteous stretch out their hands to do wrong.
125:4 Do good, O Lord, to those who are good, and to those who are upright in their hearts.
125:5 But those who turn aside to their crooked ways the Lord will lead away with evildoers! Peace be upon Israel!
text.Coverdale:
125:1 They that put their trust in the LORD shall be even as the mount Zion, *
      which may not be removed, but stands fast for ever.
125:2 The hills stand about Jerusalem; *
      even so stands the LORD round about his people, from this time forth for evermore.
125:3 For the rod of the ungodly comes not into the lot of the righteous; *
      lest the righteous put their hand unto wickedness.
125:4 Do well, O LORD, *
      unto those that are good and true of heart.
125:5 As for such as turn back unto their own wickedness, *
      the LORD shall lead them forth with the evil-doers; but peace shall be upon Israel.

text.NRSV:
126:1 When the Lord restored the fortunes of Zion, we were like those who dream.
126:2 Then our mouth was filled with laughter, and our tongue with shouts of joy; then it was said among the nations, 'The Lord has done great things for them.'
126:3 The Lord has done great things for us, and we rejoiced.
126:4 Restore our fortunes, O Lord, like the watercourses in the Negeb.
126:5 May those who sow in tears reap with shouts of joy.
126:6 Those who go out weeping, bearing the seed for sowing, shall come home with shouts of joy, carrying their sheaves.
text.Coverdale:
126:1 When the LORD turned again the captivity of Zion, *
      then were we like unto them that dream.
126:2 Then was our mouth filled with laughter, *
      and our tongue with joy.
126:3 Then said they among the heathen, *
      "The LORD has done great things for them."
126:4 Yea, the LORD has done great things for us already, *
      whereof we rejoice.
126:5 Turn our captivity, O LORD, *
      as the rivers in the south.
126:6 They that sow in tears *
      shall reap in joy.
126:7 He that now goes on his way weeping, and bears forth good seed, *
      shall doubtless come again with joy, and bring his sheaves with him.

text.NRSV:
127:1 Except the Lord build the house, their labor is but lost that build it.
127:2 Except the Lord keep the city, the watchman waketh but in vain.
127:3 It is but lost labor that ye haste to rise up early, and so late take rest, and eat the bread of carefulness; for so he giveth his beloved sleep.
127:4 Lo, children and the fruit of the womb are an heritage and gift that cometh of the Lord.
127:5 Like as the arrows in the hand of the giant, even so are the young children.
127:6 Happy is the man that hath his quiver full of them; they shall not be ashamed when they speak with their enemies in the gate.
text.Coverdale:
127:1 Except the LORD build the house, *
      their labor is but lost that build it.
127:2 Except the LORD keep the city, *
      the watchman wakes but in vain.
127:3 It is but lost labor that you haste to rise up early, and so late take rest, and eat the bread of carefulness; *
      for so he gives his beloved sleep.
127:4 Lo, children and the fruit of the womb, *
      are an heritage and gift that comes of the LORD.
127:5 Like as the arrows in the hand of the giant, *
      even so are the young children.
127:6 Happy is the man that has his quiver full of them; *
      they shall not be ashamed when they speak with their enemies in the gate.

text.NRSV:
128:1 Happy is everyone who fears the Lord, who walks in his ways.
128:2 You shall eat the fruit of the labor of your hands; you shall be happy, and it shall go well with you.
128:3 Your wife will be like a fruitful vine within your house; your children will be like olive shoots around your table.
128:4 Thus shall the man be blessed who fears the Lord.
128:5 The Lord bless you from Zion. May you see the prosperity of Jerusalem all the days of your life.
128:6 May you see your children's children. Peace be upon Israel!
text.Coverdale:
128:1 Blessed are all they that fear the LORD, *
      and walk in his ways.
128:2 For you shall eat the labors of your hands; *
      O well is you, and happy shall you be.
128:3 Your wife shall be as the fruitful vine *
      upon the walls of your house;
128:4 Your children like the olive-branches *
      round about your table.
128:5 Lo, thus shall the man be blessed *
      that fears the LORD.
128:6 The LORD from out of Zion shall so bless you, *
      that you shall see Jerusalem in prosperity all your life long.
128:7 Yea, that you shall see your children's children, *
      and peace upon Israel.

text.NRSV:
129:1 'Often have they attacked me from my youth' let Israel now say
129:2 'often have they attacked me from my youth, yet they have not prevailed against me.'
129:3 The plowers plowed upon my back; they made their furrows long.
129:4 The Lord is righteous; he has cut the cords of the wicked.
129:5 May all who hate Zion be put to shame and turned backward.
129:6 Let them be like the grass on the housetops that withers before it grows up,
129:7 with which reapers do not fill their hands or binders of sheaves their arms,
129:8 while those who pass by do not say, 'The blessing of the Lord be upon you! We bless you in the name of the Lord!'
text.Coverdale:
129:1 Many a time have they fought against me from my youth up, *
      may Israel now say.
129:2 Yea, many a time have they vexed me from my youth up; *
      but they have not prevailed against me.
129:3 The plowers plowed upon my back, *
      and made long furrows.
129:4 But the righteous LORD *
      has hewn the snares of the ungodly in pieces.
129:5 Let them be confounded and turned backward, *
      as many as have evil will at Zion.
129:6 Let them be even as the grass growing upon the house-tops, *
      which withers before it be plucked up;
129:7 Whereof the mower fills not his hand, *
      neither he that binds up the sheaves his bosom.
129:8 So that they who go by say not so much as, "The LORD prosper you; *
      we wish you good luck in the Name of the LORD."

text.NRSV:
130:1 Out of the depths I cry to you, O Lord.
130:2 Lord, hear my voice! Let your ears be attentive to the voice of my supplications!
130:3 If you, O Lord, should mark iniquities, Lord, who could stand?
130:4 But there is forgiveness with you, so that you may be revered.
130:5 I wait for the Lord, my soul waits, and in his word I hope;
130:6 my soul waits for the Lord more than those who watch for the morning, more than those who watch for the morning.
130:7 O Israel, hope in the Lord! For with the Lord there is steadfast love, and with him is great power to redeem.
130:8 It is he who will redeem Israel from all its iniquities.
text.Coverdale:
130:1 Out of the deep have I called unto you, O LORD; *
      Lord, hear my voice.
130:2 O let your ears consider well *
      the voice of my complaint.
130:3 If you, LORD, will be extreme to mark what is done amiss, *
      O Lord, who may abide it?
130:4 For there is mercy with you; *
      therefore shall you be feared.
130:5 I look for the LORD; my soul does wait for him; *
      in his word is my trust.
130:6 My soul flees unto the Lord before the morning watch; *
      I say, before the morning watch.
130:7 O Israel, trust in the LORD, for with the LORD there is mercy, *
      and with him is plenteous redemption.
130:8 And he shall redeem Israel *
      from all his sins.

text.NRSV:
131:1 O Lord, my heart is not lifted up, my eyes are not raised too high; I do not occupy myself with things too great and too marvelous for me.
131:2 But I have calmed and quieted my soul, like a weaned child with its mother; my soul is like the weaned child that is with me.
131:3 O Israel, hope in the Lord from this time forth and forevermore.
text.Coverdale:
131:1 LORD, I am not high-minded; *
      I have no proud looks.
131:2 I do not exercise myself in great matters, *
      which are too high for me.
131:3 But I refrain my soul, and keep it low, like as a child that is weaned from his mother; *
      yea, my soul is even as a weaned child.
131:4 O Israel, trust in the LORD, *
      from this time forth for evermore.

text.NRSV:
132:1 O Lord, remember in David's favor all the hardships he endured;
132:2 how he swore to the Lord and vowed to the Mighty One of Jacob,
132:3 'I will not enter my house or get into my bed;
132:4 I will not give sleep to my eyes or slumber to my eyelids,
132:5 until I find a place for the Lord, a dwelling place for the Mighty One of Jacob.'
132:6 We heard of it in Ephrathah; we found it in the fields of Jaar.
132:7 'Let us go to his dwelling place; let us worship at his footstool.'
132:8 Rise up, O Lord, and go to your resting place, you and the ark of your might.
132:9 Let your priests be clothed with righteousness, and let your faithful shout for joy.
132:10 For your servant David's sake do not turn away the face of your anointed one.
132:11 The Lord swore to David a sure oath from which he will not turn back: 'One of the sons of your body I will set on your throne.
132:12 If your sons keep my covenant and my decrees that I shall teach them, their sons also, forevermore, shall sit on your throne.'
132:13 For the Lord has chosen Zion; he has desired it for his habitation:
132:14 'This is my resting place forever; here I will reside, for I have desired it.
132:15 I will abundantly bless its provisions; I will satisfy its poor with bread.
132:16 Its priests I will clothe with salvation, and its faithful will shout for joy.
132:17 There I will cause a horn to sprout up for David; I have prepared a lamp for my anointed one.
132:18 His enemies I will clothe with disgrace, but on him, his crown will shed its luster.'
text.Coverdale:
132:1 LORD, remember David, *
      and all his trouble;
132:2 How he sware unto the LORD, *
      and vowed a vow unto the Almighty God of Jacob;
132:3 "I will not come within the tabernacle of mine house, *
      nor climb up into my bed;
132:4 I will not suffer mine eyes to sleep, nor mine eye-lids to slumber; *
      until I find out a place for the temple of the LORD, an habitation for the mighty God of Jacob."
132:5 Lo, we heard of the same at Ephrata, *
      and found it in the wood.
132:6 We will go into his tabernacle, *
      and fall low on our knees before his footstool.
132:7 Arise, O LORD, into your resting-place, *
      you, and the ark of your strength.
132:8 Let your priests be clothed with righteousness; *
      and let your saints sing with joyfulness.
132:9 For your servant David's sake, *
      turn not away the presence of your Anointed.
132:10 The LORD has made a faithful oath unto David, *
      and he shall not shrink from it;
132:11 "Of the fruit of your body *
      shall I set upon your seat.
132:12 If your children will keep my covenant, and my testimonies that I shall learn them; *
      their children also shall sit upon your seat for evermore."
132:13 For the LORD has chosen Zion to be an habitation for himself; *
      he has longed for her.
132:14 "This shall be my rest for ever; *
      here will I dwell, for I have a delight therein.
132:15 I will bless her victuals with increase, *
      and will satisfy her poor with bread.
132:16 I will deck her priests with health, *
      and her saints shall rejoice and sing.
132:17 There shall I make the horn of David to flourish; *
      I have ordained a lantern for mine Anointed.
132:18 As for his enemies, I shall clothe them with shame; *
      but upon himself shall his crown flourish."

text.NRSV:
133:1 Behold, how good and pleasant it is when brothers dwell in unity!
133:2 It is like the precious oil upon the head, running down upon the beard, upon the beard of Aaron, running down upon the collar of his robes!
133:3 It is like the dew of Hermon, which falls on the mountains of Zion! For there the Lord has commanded the blessing, life forevermore.
text.Coverdale:
133:1 Behold, how good and joyful a thing it is, *
      brethren, to dwell together in unity!
133:2 It is like the precious ointment upon the head, that ran down unto the beard, *
      even unto Aaron's beard, and went down to the skirts of his clothing.
133:3 Like as the dew of Hermon, *
      which fell upon the hill of Zion.
133:4 For there the LORD promised his blessing, *
      and life for evermore.

text.NRSV:
134:1 Come, bless the Lord, all you servants of the Lord, who stand by night in the house of the Lord!
134:2 Lift up your hands to the holy place, and bless the Lord!
134:3 May the Lord bless you from Zion, he who made heaven and earth!
text.Coverdale:
134:1 Behold now, praise the LORD, *
      all you servants of the LORD;
134:2 You that by night stand in the house of the LORD, *
      even in the courts of the house of our God.
134:3 Lift up your hands in the sanctuary, *
      and praise the LORD.
134:4 The LORD that made heaven and earth, *
      give you blessing out of Zion.

text.NRSV:
135:1 Praise the Lord! Praise the name of the Lord; give praise, O servants of the Lord,
135:2 who stand in the house of the Lord, in the courts of the house of our God.
135:3 Praise the Lord, for the Lord is good; sing to his name, for he is gracious.
135:4 For the Lord has chosen Jacob for himself, Israel as his own possession.
135:5 For I know that the Lord is great; our Lord is above all gods.
135:6 Whatever the Lord pleases he does, in heaven and on earth, in the seas and all deeps.
135:7 He it is who makes the clouds rise at the end of the earth; he makes lightnings for the rain and brings out the wind from his storehouses.
135:8 He it was who struck down the firstborn of Egypt, both human beings and animals;
135:9 he sent signs and wonders into your midst, O Egypt, against Pharaoh and all his servants.
135:10 He struck down many nations and killed mighty kings
135:11 Sihon, king of the Amorites, and Og, king of Bashan, and all the kingdoms of Canaan
135:12 and gave their land as a heritage, a heritage to his people Israel.
135:13 Your name, O Lord, endures forever, your renown, O Lord, throughout all generations.
135:14 For the Lord will vindicate his people, and have compassion on his servants.
135:15 The idols of the nations are silver and gold, the work of human hands.
135:16 They have mouths, but they do not speak; they have eyes, but they do not see;
135:17 they have ears, but they do not hear, and there is no breath in their mouths.
135:18 Those who make them and all who trust in them shall become like them.
135:19 O house of Israel, bless the Lord! O house of Aaron, bless the Lord!
135:20 O house of Levi, bless the Lord! You who fear the Lord, bless the Lord!
135:21 Blessed be the Lord from Zion, he who resides in Jerusalem. Praise the Lord!
text.Coverdale:
135:1 O praise the LORD, praise you the Name of the LORD; *
      praise it, O you servants of the LORD;
135:2 You that stand in the house of the LORD, *
      in the courts of the house of our God.
135:3 O praise the LORD, for the LORD is gracious; *
      O sing praises unto his Name, for it is lovely.
135:4 For why? the LORD has chosen Jacob unto himself, *
      and Israel for his own possession.
135:5 For I know that the LORD is great, *
      and that our Lord is above all gods.
135:6 Whatsoever the LORD pleased, that did he in heaven, and in earth; *
      and in the sea, and in all deep places.
135:7 He brings forth the clouds from the ends of the world, *
      and sends forth lightnings with the rain, bringing the winds out of his treasures.
135:8 He smote the first-born of Egypt, *
      both of man and beast.
135:9 He has sent tokens and wonders into the midst of you, O thou land of Egypt, *
      upon Pharaoh, and all his servants.
135:10 He smote divers nations, *
      and slew mighty kings;
135:11 Sihon, king of the Amorites, and Og, the king of Bashan, *
      and all the kingdoms of Canaan;
135:12 And gave their land to be an heritage, *
      even an heritage unto Israel his people.
135:13 Your Name, O LORD, endures for ever; *
      so does your memorial, O LORD, from one generation to another.
135:14 For the LORD will avenge his people, *
      and be gracious unto his servants.
135:15 As for the images of the heathen, they are but silver and gold, *
      the work of men's hands.
135:16 They have mouths, and speak not; *
      eyes have they, but they see not.
135:17 They have ears, and yet they hear not; *
      neither is there any breath in their mouths.
135:18 They that make them are like unto them; *
      and so are all they that put their trust in them.
135:19 Praise the LORD, you house of Israel; *
      praise the LORD, you house of Aaron.
135:20 Praise the LORD, you house of Levi; *
      you that fear the LORD, praise the LORD.
135:21 Praised be the LORD out of Zion, *
      who dwells at Jerusalem.

136:1 O give thanks unto the LORD, for he is gracious: *
      and his mercy endures for ever.
136:2 O give thanks unto the God of all gods: *
      for his mercy endures for ever.
136:3 O thank the Lord of all lords: *
      for his mercy endures for ever.
136:4 Who only does great wonders: *
      for his mercy endures for ever.
136:5 Who by his excellent wisdom made the heavens: *
      for his mercy endures for ever.
136:6 Who laid out the earth above the waters: *
      for his mercy endures for ever.
136:7 Who has made great lights: *
      for his mercy endures for ever;
136:8 The sun to rule the day: *
      for his mercy endures for ever;
136:9 The moon and the stars to govern the night: *
      for his mercy endures for ever.
136:10 Who smote Egypt with their first-born: *
      for his mercy endures for ever;
136:11 And brought out Israel from among them: *
      for his mercy endures for ever;
136:12 With a mighty hand, and stretched-out arm: *
      for his mercy endures for ever.
136:13 Who divided the Red Sea in two parts: *
      for his mercy endures for ever;
136:14 And made Israel to go through the midst of it: *
      for his mercy endures for ever;
136:15 But as for Pharaoh and his host, he overthrew them in the Red Sea: *
      for his mercy endures for ever.
136:16 Who led his people through the wilderness: *
      for his mercy endures for ever.
136:17 Who smote great kings: *
      for his mercy endures for ever;
136:18 Yea, and slew mighty kings: *
      for his mercy endures for ever;
136:19 Sihon king of the Amorites: *
      for his mercy endures for ever;
136:20 And Og the king of Bashan: *
      for his mercy endures for ever;
136:21 And gave away their land for an heritage: *
      for his mercy endures for ever;
136:22 Even for an heritage unto Israel his servant: *
      for his mercy endures for ever.
136:23 Who remembered us when we were in trouble: *
      for his mercy endures for ever;
136:24 And has delivered us from our enemies: *
      for his mercy endures for ever.
136:25 Who gives food to all flesh: *
      for his mercy endures for ever.
136:26 O give thanks unto the God of heaven: *
      for his mercy endures for ever.
136:27 O give thanks unto the Lord of lords: *
      for his mercy endures for ever.

text.NRSV:
137:1 By the rivers of Babylon there we sat down and there we wept when we remembered Zion.
137:2 On the willows there we hung up our lyres.
137:3 For there our captors asked us for songs, and our tormentors asked for mirth, saying, 'Sing us one of the songs of Zion!'
137:4 How could we sing the Lord's song in a foreign land?
137:5 If I forget you, O Jerusalem, let my right hand wither!
137:6 Let my tongue cling to the roof of my mouth, if I do not remember you, if I do not set Jerusalem above my highest joy.
137:7 Remember, O Lord, against the Edomites the day of Jerusalem's fall, how they said, 'Tear it down! Tear it down! Down to its foundations!'
137:8 O daughter Babylon, you devastator! Happy shall they be who pay you back what you have done to us!
137:9 Happy shall they be who take your little ones and dash them against the rock!
text.Coverdale:
137:1 By the waters of Babylon we sat down and wept, *
      when we remembered you, O Zion.
137:2 As for our harps, we hanged them up *
      upon the trees that are therein.
137:3 For they that led us away captive required of us then a song, and melody, in our heaviness; *
      "Sing us one of the songs of Zion."
137:4 How shall we sing the LORD's song *
      in a strange land?
137:5 If I forget you, O Jerusalem, *
      let my right hand forget her cunning.
137:6 If I do not remember you, let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth; *
      yea, if I prefer not Jerusalem in my mirth.
137:7 Remember the children of Edom, O LORD, in the day of Jerusalem, *
      how they said, "Down with it, down with it, even to the ground."
137:8 O daughter of Babylon, wasted with misery; *
      yea, happy shall he be that rewards you, as you have served us.
137:9 Blessed shall he be that takes your children, *
      and throws them against the stones.

text.NRSV:
138:1 I give you thanks, O Lord, with my whole heart; before the gods I sing your praise;
