138:2 I bow down toward your holy temple and give thanks to your name for your steadfast love and your faithfulness; for you have exalted your name and your word above everything.
138:3 On the day I called, you answered me, you increased my strength of soul.
138:4 All the kings of the earth shall praise you, O Lord, for they have heard the words of your mouth.
138:5 They shall sing of the ways of the Lord, for great is the glory of the Lord.
138:6 For though the Lord is high, he regards the lowly; but the haughty he perceives from far away.
138:7 Though I walk in the midst of trouble, you preserve me against the wrath of my enemies; you stretch out your hand, and your right hand delivers me.
138:8 The Lord will fulfill his purpose for me; your steadfast love, O Lord, endures forever. Do not forsake the work of your hands.
text.Coverdale:
138:1 I will give thanks unto you, O Lord, with my whole heart; *
      even before the gods will I sing praise unto you.
138:2 I will worship toward your holy temple, and praise your Name, because of your loving-kindness and truth; *
      for you have magnified your Name, and your Word, above all things.
138:3 When I called upon you, you heard me, *
      and endued my soul with much strength.
138:4 All the kings of the earth shall praise you, O LORD; *
      for they have heard the words of your mouth.
138:5 Yea, they shall sing in the ways of the LORD, *
      that great is the glory of the LORD.
138:6 For though the LORD be high, yet has he respect unto the lowly; *
      as for the proud, he beholds them afar off.
138:7 Though I walk in the midst of trouble, yet shall you refresh me; *
      you shall stretch forth your hand upon the furiousness of mine enemies, and your right hand shall save me.
138:8 The LORD shall make good his loving-kindness toward me; *
      yea, your mercy, O LORD, endures for ever; despise not then the works of thine own hands.

text.NRSV:
139:1 O Lord, you have searched me and known me.
139:2 You know when I sit down and when I rise up; you discern my thoughts from far away.
139:3 You search out my path and my lying down, and are acquainted with all my ways.
139:4 Even before a word is on my tongue, O Lord, you know it completely.
139:5 You hem me in, behind and before, and lay your hand upon me.
139:6 Such knowledge is too wonderful for me; it is so high that I cannot attain it.
139:7 Where can I go from your spirit? Or where can I flee from your presence?
139:8 If I ascend to heaven, you are there; if I make my bed in Sheol, you are there.
139:9 If I take the wings of the morning and settle at the farthest limits of the sea,
139:10 even there your hand shall lead me, and your right hand shall hold me fast.
139:11 If I say, 'Surely the darkness shall cover me, and the light around me become night,'
139:12 even the darkness is not dark to you; the night is as bright as the day, for darkness is as light to you.
139:13 For it was you who formed my inward parts; you knit me together in my mother's womb.
139:14 I praise you, for I am fearfully and wonderfully made. Wonderful are your works; that I know very well.
139:15 My frame was not hidden from you, when I was being made in secret, intricately woven in the depths of the earth.
139:16 Your eyes beheld my unformed substance. In your book were written all the days that were formed for me, when none of them as yet existed.
139:17 How weighty to me are your thoughts, O God! How vast is the sum of them!
139:18 I try to count themthey are more than the sand; I come to the endI am still with you.
139:19 O that you would kill the wicked, O God, and that the bloodthirsty would depart from me
139:20 those who speak of you maliciously, and lift themselves up against you for evil!
139:21 Do I not hate those who hate you, O Lord? And do I not loathe those who rise up against you?
139:22 I hate them with perfect hatred; I count them my enemies.
139:23 Search me, O God, and know my heart; test me and know my thoughts.
139:24 See if there is any wicked way in me, and lead me in the way everlasting.
text.Coverdale:
139:1 O LORD, you have searched me out, and known me; *
      you know my down-sitting, and mine up-rising; you understand my thoughts long before.
139:2 You are about my path, and about my bed, *
      and art acquainted with all my ways.
139:3 For lo, there is not a word in my tongue, *
      but you, O LORD, know it altogether.
139:4 You have fashioned me behind and before, *
      and laid your hand upon me.
139:5 Such knowledge is too wonderful and excellent for me; *
      I cannot attain unto it.
139:6 Whither shall I go then from your Spirit? *
      or whither shall I go then from your presence?
139:7 If I climb up into heaven, you are there; *
      if I go down to hell, you are there also.
139:8 If I take the wings of the morning, *
      and remain in the uttermost parts of the sea;
139:9 Even there also shall your hand lead me, *
      and your right hand shall hold me.
139:10 If I say, "Peradventure the darkness shall cover me;" *
      then shall my night be turned to day.
139:11 Yea, the darkness is no darkness with you, but the night is as clear as the day; *
      the darkness and light to you are both alike.
139:12 For my reins are yours; *
      you have covered me in my mother's womb.
139:13 I will give thanks unto you, for I am fearfully and wonderfully made; *
      marvelous are your works, and that my soul knows right well.
139:14 My bones are not hid from you, *
      though I be made secretly, and fashioned beneath in the earth.
139:15 Your eyes did see my substance, yet being imperfect; *
      and in your book were all my members written;
139:16 Which day by day were fashioned, *
      when as yet there was none of them.
139:17 How dear are your counsels unto me, O God! *
      O how great is the sum of them!
139:18 If I tell them, they are more in number than the sand; *
      when I wake up, I am present with you.
139:19 Wilt not you slay the wicked, O God? *
      depart from me, you blood-thirsty men.
139:20 For they speak unrighteously against you; *
      and your enemies take your Name in vain.
139:21 Do not I hate them, O LORD, that hate you? *
      and am not I grieved with those who rise up against you?
139:22 Yea, I hate them right sore; *
      even as though they were mine enemies.
139:23 Try me, O God, and seek the ground of my heart; *
      prove me, and examine my thoughts.
139:24 Look well if there be any way of wickedness in me; *
      and lead me in the way everlasting.

text.NRSV:
140:1 Deliver me, O Lord, from evildoers; protect me from those who are violent,
140:2 who plan evil things in their minds and stir up wars continually.
140:3 They make their tongue sharp as a snake's, and under their lips is the venom of vipers. Selah
140:4 Guard me, O Lord, from the hands of the wicked; protect me from the violent who have planned to my steps to trip me up.
140:5 The proud have hidden a snare for me, and with cords they have spread a net, along the road they have set traps for me. Selah
140:6 I say to the Lord, 'You are my God; give ear, O Lord, to the voice of my supplications.'
140:7 O Lord my Lord, my strong deliverer, you have covered my head in the day of battle.
140:8 Do not grant, O Lord, the desires of the wicked; do not further their evil plot. Selah
140:9 Those who surround me lift up their heads; let the mischief of their lips overwhelm them!
140:10 Let burning coals fall on them! Let them be flung into pits, no more to rise!
140:11 Let not the slanderer be established in the land; let evil speed the violent for their destruction!
140:12 I know that the Lord maintains the cause of the needy, and executes justice for the poor.
140:13 Surely the righteous shall give thanks to your name; the upright shall live in your presence.
text.Coverdale:
140:1 Deliver me, O LORD, from the evil man; *
      and preserve me from the wicked man.
140:2 Who imagine mischief in their hearts, *
      and stir up strife all the day long.
140:3 They have sharpened their tongues like a serpent; *
      adder's poison is under their lips.
140:4 Keep me, O LORD, from the hands of the ungodly; *
      preserve me from the wicked men, who are purposed to overthrow my goings.
140:5 The proud have laid a snare for me, and spread a net with cords; *
      yea, and set traps in my way.
140:6 I said unto the LORD, "You are my God; *
      hear the voice of my prayers, O LORD."
140:7 O LORD God, you strength of my health; *
      you have covered my head in the day of battle.
140:8 Let not the ungodly have his desire, O LORD; *
      let not his mischievous imagination prosper, lest they be too proud.
140:9 Let the mischief of their own lips fall upon the head of them *
      that compass me about.
140:10 Let hot burning coals fall upon them; *
      let them be cast into the fire, and into the pit, that they never rise up again.
140:11 A man full of words shall not prosper upon the earth; *
      evil shall hunt the wicked person to over-throw him.
140:12 Sure I am that the LORD will avenge the poor, *
      and maintain the cause of the helpless.
140:13 The righteous also shall give thanks unto your Name; *
      and the just shall continue in your sight.

text.NRSV:
141:1 I call upon you, O Lord; come quickly to me; give ear to my voice when I call to you.
141:2 Let my prayer be counted as incense before you, and the lifting up of my hands as an evening sacrifice.
141:3 Set a guard over my mouth, O Lord; keep watch over the door of my lips.
141:4 Do not turn my heart to any evil, to busy myself with wicked deeds in company with those who work iniquity; do not let me eat of their delicacies.
141:5 Let the righteous strike me in kindness and reprove me; do not let oil of the wicked adorn my head, for my prayer is continually against their wicked deeds.
141:6 When they are given over to those who shall condemn them, then they shall learn that my words were pleasant.
141:7 Like a rock that one breaks apart and shatters on the land, so shall their bones be strewn at the mouth of Sheol.
141:8 But my eyes are turned toward you, O Lord my Lord; in you I take refuge; do not leave me defenseless.
141:9 Keep me from the trap that they have laid for me, and from the snares of evildoers.
141:10 Let the wicked fall into their own nets, while I alone pass by.
text.Coverdale:
141:1 LORD, I call upon you, haste you unto me, *
      and consider my voice when I cry unto you.
141:2 Let my prayer be set forth in your sight as the incense; *
      and let the lifting up of my hands be an evening sacrifice.
141:3 Set a watch, O LORD, before my mouth, *
      and keep the door of my lips.
141:4 O let not mine heart be inclined to any evil thing; *
      let me not be occupied in ungodly works with the men that work wickedness, lest I eat of such things as please them.
141:5 Let the righteous rather smite me friendly, and reprove me; *
      but let not their precious balms break my head; yea, I will pray yet against their wickedness.
141:6 Let their judges be overthrown in stony places, *
      that they may hear my words, for they are sweet.
141:7 Our bones lie scattered before the pit, *
      like as when one breaks and hews wood upon the earth.
141:8 But mine eyes look unto you, O LORD God; *
      in you is my trust, O cast not out my soul.
141:9 Keep me from the snare that they have laid for me, *
      and from the traps of the wicked doers.
141:10 Let the ungodly fall into their own nets together, *
      and let me ever escape them.

text.NRSV:
142:1 With my voice I cry to the Lord; with my voice I make supplication to the Lord.
142:2 I pour out my complaint before him; I tell my trouble before him.
142:3 When my spirit is faint, you know my way. In the path where I walk they have hidden a snare for me.
142:4 Look on my right hand and see there is no one who takes notice of me; no refuge remains to me; no one cares for me.
142:5 I cry to you, O Lord; I say, 'You are my refuge, my portion in the land of the living.'
142:6 Give heed to my cry, for I am brought very low. Save me from my persecutors, for they are too strong for me.
142:7 Bring me out of prison, so that I may give thanks to your name. The righteous will surround me, for you will deal bountifully with me.
text.Coverdale:
142:1 I cried unto the LORD with my voice; *
      yea, even unto the LORD did I make my humble supplication.
142:2 I poured out my complaints before him, *
      and showed him of my trouble.
142:3 When my spirit was in heaviness, you knewest my path; *
      in the way wherein I walked have they privily laid a snare for me.
142:4 I looked also upon my right hand, *
      and saw there was no man that would know me.
142:5 I had no place to flee unto, *
      and no man cared for my soul.
142:6 I cried unto you, O LORD, and said, *
      "You are my hope, and my portion in the land of the living."
142:7 Consider my complaint, *
      for I am brought very low.
142:8 O deliver me from my persecutors, *
      for they are too strong for me.
142:9 Bring my soul out of prison, that I may give thanks unto your Name; *
      which thing if you wilt grant me, then shall the righteous resort unto my company.

text.NRSV:
143:1 Hear my prayer, O Lord; give ear to my supplications in your faithfulness; answer me in your righteousness.
143:2 Do not enter into judgment with your servant, for no one living is righteous before you.
143:3 For the enemy has pursued me, crushing my life to the ground, making me sit in darkness like those long dead.
143:4 Therefore my spirit faints within me; my heart within me is appalled.
143:5 I remember the days of old, I think about all your deeds, I meditate on the works of your hands.
143:6 I stretch out my hands to you; my soul thirsts for you like a parched land. Selah
143:7 Answer me quickly, O Lord; my spirit fails. Do not hide your face from me, or I shall be like those who go down to the Pit.
143:8 Let me hear of your steadfast love in the morning, for in you I put my trust. Teach me the way I should go, for to you I lift up my soul.
143:9 Deliver me from my enemies, O Lord; I have fled to you for refuge.
143:10 Teach me to do your will, for you are my God. Let your good spirit lead me on a level path.
143:11 For your name's sake, O Lord, preserve my life; in your righteousness bring me out of trouble.
143:12 In your steadfast love cut off my enemies, and destroy all my adversaries, for I am your servant.
text.Coverdale:
143:1 Hear my prayer, O LORD, and consider my desire; *
      hearken unto me for your truth and righteousness' sake.
143:2 And enter not into judgment with your servant; *
      for in your sight shall no man living be justified.
143:3 For the enemy has persecuted my soul; he has smitten my life down to the ground; *
      he has laid me in the darkness, as the men that have been long dead.
143:4 Therefore is my spirit vexed within me, *
      and my heart within me is desolate.
143:5 I remember the time past; I muse upon all your works; *
      yea, I exercise myself in the works of your hands.
143:6 I stretch forth my hands unto you; *
      my soul gasps unto you as a thirsty land.
143:7 Hear me, O LORD, and that soon, for my spirit waxes faint; *
      hide not your face from me, lest I be like unto them that go down into the pit.
143:8 O let me hear your loving-kindness betimes in the morning, for in you is my trust; *
      show you me the way that I should walk in, for I lift up my soul unto you.
143:9 Deliver me, O LORD, from mine enemies; *
      for I flee unto you to hide me.
143:10 Teach me to do the thing that pleases you, for you are my God; *
      let your loving Spirit lead me forth into the land of righteousness.
143:11 Quicken me, O LORD, for your Name's sake; *
      and for your righteousness' sake bring my soul out of trouble.
143:12 And of your goodness slay mine enemies, *
      and destroy all them that vex my soul; for I am your servant.

text.NRSV:
144:1 Blessed be the Lord, my rock, who trains my hands for war, and my fingers for battle;
144:2 my rock and my fortress, my stronghold and my deliverer, my shield, in whom I take refuge, who subdues the peoples under me.
144:3 O Lord, what are human beings that you regard them, or mortals that you think of them?
144:4 They are like a breath; their days are like a passing shadow.
144:5 Bow your heavens, O Lord, and come down; touch the mountains so that they smoke.
144:6 Hurling lightning and scatter them; shoot out your arrows and rout them.
144:7 Stretch out your hand from on high; set me free and rescue me from the mighty waters, from the hand of aliens,
144:8 whose mouths speak lies, and whose right hands are false.
144:9 I will sing a new song to you, O God; upon a ten-stringed harp I will play to you,
144:10 the one who gives victory to kings, who rescues his servant David. From the cruel sword
144:11 set me free, and rescue me from the hand of aliens, whose mouths speak lies, and whose right hands are false.
144:12 May our sons in their youth be like plants full grown, our daughters like corner pillars, cut for the building of a palace.
144:13 May our barns be filled, with produce of every kind; may our sheep increase by tens of thousands in our fields;
144:14 may our cattle be heavy with young, may there be no breach in the walls, no exile, and no cry of distress in our streets.
144:15 Happy are the people to whom such blessings fall; happy are the people whose God is the Lord.
text.Coverdale:
144:1 Blessed be the LORD my strength, *
      who teaches my hands to war, and my fingers to fight;
144:2 My hope and my fortress, my castle and deliverer, my defender in whom I trust, *
      who subdues my people that is under me.
144:3 LORD, what is man, that you hast such respect unto him? *
      or the son of man, that you so regardest him?
144:4 Man is like a thing of nought; *
      his time passes away like a shadow.
144:5 Bow your heavens, O LORD, and come down; *
      touch the mountains, and they shall smoke.
144:6 Cast forth your lightning, and tear them; *
      shoot out your arrows, and consume them.
144:7 Send down your hand from above; *
      deliver me, and take me out of the great waters, from the hand of strange children;
144:8 Whose mouth talks of vanity, *
      and their right hand is a right hand of wickedness.
144:9 I will sing a new song unto you, O God, *
      and sing praises unto you upon a ten-stringed lute.
144:10 You have given victory unto kings, *
      and have delivered David your servant from the peril of the sword.
144:11 Save me, and deliver me from the hand of strange children, *
      whose mouth talks of vanity, and their right hand is a right hand of iniquity.
144:12 That our sons may grow up as the young plants, *
      and that our daughters may be as the polished corners of the temple.
144:13 That our garners may be full and plenteous with all manner of store; *
      that our sheep may bring forth thousands and ten thousands in our streets.
144:14 That our oxen may be strong to labor, that there be no decay, *
      no leading into captivity, and no complaining in our streets.
144:15 Happy are the people that are in such a case; *
      yea, blessed are the people who have the LORD for their God.

text.NRSV:
145:1 I will extol you, my God and King, and bless your name forever and ever.
145:2 Every day I will bless you, and praise your name forever and ever.
145:3 Great is the Lord, and greatly to be praised; his greatness is unsearchable.
145:4 One generation shall laud your works to another, and shall declare your mighty acts.
145:5 On the glorious splendor of your majesty, and on your wondrous works, I will meditate.
145:6 The might of your awesome deeds shall be proclaimed, and I will declare your greatness.
145:7 They shall celebrate the fame of your abundant goodness, and shall sing aloud of your righteousness.
145:8 The Lord is gracious and merciful, slow to anger and abounding in steadfast love.
145:9 The Lord is good to all, and his compassion is over all that he has made.
145:10 All your works shall give thanks to you, O Lord, and all your faithful shall bless you.
145:11 They shall speak of the glory of your kingdom, and tell of your power,
145:12 to make known to all people your mighty deeds, and the glorious splendor of your kingdom.
145:13 Your kingdom is an everlasting kingdom, and your dominion endures throughout all generations. The Lord is faithful in all his words, and gracious in all his deeds.
145:14 The Lord upholds all who are falling, and raises up all who are bowed down.
145:15 The eyes of all look to you, and you give them their food in due season.
145:16 You open your hand, satisfying the desire of every living thing.
145:17 The Lord is just in all his ways, and kind in all his doings.
145:18 The Lord is near to all who call on him, to all who call on him in truth.
145:19 He fulfills the desire of all who fear him; he also hears their cry, and saves them.
145:20 The Lord watches over all who love him, but all the wicked he will destroy.
145:21 My mouth will speak the praise of the Lord, and all flesh will bless his holy name forever and ever.
text.Coverdale:
145:1 I will magnify you, O God, my King; *
      and I will praise your Name for ever and ever.
145:2 Every day will I give thanks unto you, *
      and praise your Name for ever and ever.
145:3 Great is the LORD, and marvellous, worthy to be praised; *
      there is no end of his greatness.
145:4 One generation shall praise your works unto another, *
      and declare your power.
145:5 As for me, I will be talking of your worship, *
      your glory, your praise, and wondrous works;
145:6 So that men shall speak of the might of your marvelous acts; *
      and I will also tell of your greatness.
145:7 The memorial of your abundant kindness shall be showed; *
      and men shall sing of your righteousness.
145:8 The LORD is gracious, and merciful, *
      long-suffering, and of great goodness.
145:9 The LORD is loving unto every man, *
      and his mercy is over all his works.
145:10 All your works praise you, O LORD; *
      and your saints give thanks unto you.
145:11 They show the glory of your kingdom, *
      and talk of your power;
145:12 That your power, your glory, and mightiness of your kingdom, *
      might be known unto men.
145:13 Your kingdom is an everlasting kingdom, *
      and your dominion endures throughout all ages.
145:14 The LORD upholds all such as fall, *
      and lifts up all those who are down.
145:15 The eyes of all wait upon you, O Lord; *
      and you give them their meat in due season.
145:16 You open your hand, *
      and fillest all things living with plenteousness.
145:17 The LORD is righteous in all his ways, *
      and holy in all his works.
145:18 The LORD is nigh unto all them that call upon him; *
      yea, all such as call upon him faithfully.
145:19 He will fulfill the desire of them that fear him; *
      he also will hear their cry, and will help them.
145:20 The LORD preserves all them that love him; *
      but scatters abroad all the ungodly.
145:21 My mouth shall speak the praise of the LORD; *
      and let all flesh give thanks unto his holy Name for ever and ever.

text.NRSV:
146:1 Praise the Lord! Praise the Lord, O my soul!
146:2 I will praise the Lord as long as I live; I will sing praises to my God all my life long.
146:3 Do not put your trust in princes, in mortals, in whom there is no help.
146:4 When their breath departs, they return to the earth; on that very day their plans perish.
146:5 Happy are those whose help is the God of Jacob, whose hope is in the Lord their God,
146:6 who made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that is in them; who keeps faith forever;
146:7 who executes justice for the oppressed; who gives food to the hungry. The Lord sets the prisoners free;
146:8 the Lord opens the eyes of the blind. The Lord lifts up those who are bowed down; the Lord loves the righteous.
146:9 The Lord watches over the strangers; he upholds the orphan and the widow, but the way of the wicked he brings to ruin.
146:10 The Lord will reign forever, your God, O Zion, for all generations. Praise the Lord!
text.Coverdale:
146:1 Praise the LORD, O my soul; while I live will I praise the LORD; *
      yea, as long as I have any being, I will sing praises unto my God.
146:2 O put not your trust in princes, nor in any child of man; *
      for there is no help in them.
146:3 For when the breath of man goes forth he shall turn again to his earth, *
      and then all his thoughts perish.
146:4 Blessed is he that has the God of Jacob for his help, *
      and whose hope is in the LORD his God;
146:5 Who made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that therein is; *
      who keeps his promise for ever;
146:6 Who helps them to right that suffer wrong; *
      who feeds the hungry.
146:7 The LORD looses men out of prison; *
      the LORD gives sight to the blind.
146:8 The LORD helps them that are fallen; *
      the LORD cares for the righteous.
146:9 The LORD cares for the strangers; he defends the fatherless and widow; *
      as for the way of the ungodly, he turns it upside down.
146:10 The LORD your God, O Zion, shall be King for evermore, *
      and throughout all generations.

text.NRSV:
147:1 Praise the Lord! How good it is to sing praises to our God; for he is gracious, and a song of praise is fitting.
147:2 The Lord builds up Jerusalem; he gathers the outcasts of Israel.
147:3 He heals the brokenhearted, and binds up their wounds.
147:4 He determines the number of the stars; he gives to all of them their names.
147:5 Great is our Lord, and abundant in power; his understanding is beyond measure.
147:6 The Lord lifts up the downtrodden; he casts the wicked to the ground.
147:7 Sing to the Lord with thanksgiving; make melody to our God on the lyre.
147:8 He covers the heavens with clouds, prepares rain for the earth, makes grass grow on the hills.
147:9 He gives to the animals their food, and to the young ravens when they cry.
147:10 His delight is not in the strength of the horse, nor his pleasure in the speed of a runner;
147:11 but the Lord takes pleasure in those who fear him, in those who hope in his steadfast love.
147:12 Praise the Lord, O Jerusalem! Praise your God, O Zion!
147:13 For he strengthens the bars of your gates; he blesses your children within you.
147:14 He grants peace within your borders; he fills you with the finest of wheat.
147:15 He sends out his command to the earth; his word runs swiftly.
147:16 He gives snow like wool; he scatters frost like ashes.
147:17 He hurls down his crystals of ice like crumbs who can stand before his cold?
147:18 He sends out his word, and melts them; he makes his wind blow, and the waters flow.
147:19 He declares his word to Jacob, his statutes and ordinances to Israel.
147:20 He has not dealt thus with any other nation; they do not know his ordinances. Praise the Lord!
text.Coverdale:
147:1 O praise the LORD, for it is a good thing to sing praises unto our God; *
      yea, a joyful and pleasant thing it is to be thankful.
147:2 The LORD does build up Jerusalem, *
      and gather together the outcasts of Israel.
147:3 He heals those who are broken in heart, *
      and gives medicine to heal their sickness.
147:4 He tells the number of the stars, *
      and calls them all by their names.
147:5 Great is our Lord, and great is his power; *
      yea, and his wisdom is infinite.
147:6 The LORD sets up the meek, *
      and brings the ungodly down to the ground.
147:7 O sing unto the LORD with thanksgiving; *
      sing praises upon the harp unto our God;
147:8 Who covers the heaven with clouds, and prepares rain for the earth, *
      and makes the grass to grow upon the mountains, and herb for the use of men;
147:9 Who gives fodder unto the cattle, *
      and feeds the young ravens that call upon him.
147:10 He has no pleasure in the strength of an horse; *
      neither delights he in any man's legs.
147:11 But the LORD's delight is in them that fear him, *
      and put their trust in his mercy.
147:12 Praise the LORD, O Jerusalem; *
      praise your God, O Zion.
147:13 For he has made fast the bars of your gates, *
      and has blessed your children within you.
147:14 He makes peace in your borders, *
      and fills you with the flour of wheat.
147:15 He sends forth his commandment upon earth, *
      and his word runs very swiftly.
147:16 He gives snow like wool, *
      and scatters the hoar-frost like ashes.
147:17 He casts forth his ice like morsels; *
      who is able to abide his frost?
147:18 He sends out his word, and melts them; *
      he blows with his wind, and the waters flow.
147:19 He shows his word unto Jacob, *
      his statutes and ordinances unto Israel.
147:20 He has not dealt so with any nation; *
      neither have the heathen knowledge of his laws.

text.NRSV:
148:1 Praise the Lord! Praise the Lord from the heavens; praise him in the heights!
148:2 Praise him, all his angels; praise him, all his host!
148:3 Praise him, sun and moon; praise him, all you shining stars!
148:4 Praise him, you highest heavens, and you waters above the heavens!
148:5 Let them praise the name of the Lord, for he commanded and they were created.
148:6 He established them forever and ever; he fixed their bounds, which cannot be passed.
148:7 Praise the Lord from the earth, you sea monsters and all deeps,
148:8 fire and hail, snow and frost, stormy wind fulfilling his command!
148:9 Mountains and all hills, fruit trees and all cedars!
148:10 Wild animals and all cattle, creeping things and flying birds!
148:11 Kings of the earth and all peoples, princes and all rulers of the earth!
148:12 Young men and women alike, old and young together!
148:13 Let them praise the name of the Lord, for his name alone is exalted; his glory is above earth and heaven.
148:14 He has raised up a horn for his people, praise for all his faithful, for the people of Israel who are close to him. Praise the Lord!
text.Coverdale:
148:1 O praise the LORD of heaven, *
      praise him in the height.
148:2 Praise him, all you angels of his; *
      praise him, all his host.
148:3 Praise him, sun and moon; *
      praise him, all you stars and light.
148:4 Praise him, all you heavens, *
      and you waters that are above the heavens.
148:5 Let them praise the Name of the LORD; *
      for he spake the word, and they were made; he commanded, and they were created.
148:6 He has made them fast for ever and ever; *
      he has given them a law which shall not be broken.
148:7 Praise the LORD upon earth, *
      you dragons and all deeps;
148:8 Fire and hail, snow and vapors, *
      wind and storm, fulfilling his word;
148:9 Mountains and all hills; *
      fruitful trees and all cedars;
148:10 Beasts and all cattle; *
      worms and feathered fowls;
148:11 Kings of the earth and all people; *
      princes and all judges of the world;
148:12 Young men and maidens, old men and children, praise the Name of the LORD; *
      for his Name only is excellent, and his praise above heaven and earth.
148:13 He shall exalt the horn of his people; all his saints shall praise him; *
      even the children of Israel, even the people that serves him.

text.NRSV:
149:1 Praise the Lord! Sing to the Lord a new song, his praise in the assembly of the faithful.
149:2 Let Israel be glad in its Maker; let the children of Zion rejoice in their King.
149:3 Let them praise his name with dancing, making melody to him with tambourine and lyre.
149:4 For the Lord takes pleasure in his people; he adorns the humble with victory.
149:5 Let the faithful exult in glory; let them sing for joy on their couches.
149:6 Let the high praises of God be in their throats and two-edged swords in their hands,
149:7 to execute vengeance on the nations and punishment on the peoples,
149:8 to bind their kings with fetters and their nobles with chains of iron,
149:9 to execute on them the judgment decreed. This is glory for all his faithful ones. Praise the Lord!
text.Coverdale:
149:1 O sing unto the LORD a new song; *
      let the congregation of saints praise him.
149:2 Let Israel rejoice in him that made him, *
      and let the children of Zion be joyful in their King.
149:3 Let them praise his Name in the dance; *
      let them sing praises unto him with tabret and harp.
149:4 For the LORD has pleasure in his people, *
      and helps the meek-hearted.
149:5 Let the saints be joyful with glory; *
      let them rejoice in their beds.
149:6 Let the praises of God be in their mouth; *
      and a two-edged sword in their hands;
149:7 To be avenged of the heathen, *
      and to rebuke the people;
149:8 To bind their kings in chains, *
      and their nobles with links of iron.
149:9 That they may be avenged of them, as it is written, *
      Such honor have all his saints.

text.NRSV:
150:1 Praise the Lord! Praise God in his sanctuary; praise him in his mighty firmament!
150:2 Praise him for his mighty deeds; praise him according to his surpassing greatness!
150:3 Praise him with trumpet sound; praise him with lute and harp!
150:4 Praise him with tambourine and dance; praise him with strings and pipe!
150:5 Praise him with clanging cymbals; praise him with loud clashing cymbals!
150:6 Let everything that breathes praise the Lord! Praise the Lord!
text.Coverdale:
150:1 O praise God in his holiness; *
      praise him in the firmament of his power.
150:2 Praise him in his noble acts; *
      praise him according to his excellent greatness.
150:3 Praise him in the sound of the trumpet; *
      praise him upon the lute and harp.
150:4 Praise him in the cymbals and dances; *
      praise him upon the strings and pipe.
150:5 Praise him upon the well-tuned cymbals; *
      praise him upon the loud cymbals.

text.Orthodox:
151:1 I was small among my brothers and the youngest in my father's house. I tended my father's sheep.
151:2 My hands made a harp; my fingers fashioned a lyre.
151:3 And who will tell my Lord? The Lord himself; it is he who hears.
151:4 It was he who sent his messenger and took me from my father's sheep, and anointed me with his holy oil.
151:5 My brothers were handsome and tall, but the Lord was not pleased with them.
151:6 I went out to meet the Philistine, and he cursed me by his idols.
151:7 But I drew his own sword; I beheaded him, and took away reproach from the people of Israel.

152:1 When I was a youth, I was chosen of the Lord, and he took me and anointed me.
152:2 I was a shepherd of my father's flock, and I kept them in the wilderness.
152:3 A lion came out of the forest and a wolf out of the desert, and they were devouring my sheep.
152:4 But I went out against them and I slew them, and I delivered my flock from their mouth.
152:5 Glory to the Lord, who gave me strength to overcome the beasts of the field!

153:1 O Lord, deliver me from the hands of the enemy, and save me from the mouth of the lion.
153:2 For the lion is strong and the enemy is cruel, and they have compassed me about on every side.
153:3 But you, O Lord, are my strength and my helper; you have delivered me from the peril of death.
153:4 Praise be to you, O Lord, for your mercy is great and your goodness is for ever.

154:1 Glorify God with a loud voice; proclaim His glory in the assembly of many.
154:2 In the multitude of the righteous glorify His praise; and speak of His glory with the righteous.
154:3 Join your souls with the good and with the perfect, to glorify the Most High.
154:4 Assemble yourselves together to make known His salvation; and be not slow in showing forth His strength and His majesty to all the simple.
154:5 That the honor of the Lord may be known, wisdom hath been given; and to tell of His works it was made known to men: to declare to the simple His righteousness, to make the ignorant understand His greatness; to set before the humble the knowledge of His majesty.
154:6 Draw nigh then, ye that fear the Lord, and hear His word.
154:7 Receive the wisdom of the Lord, and walk in it, and walk not in the way of unrighteousness.
154:8 Let him that feareth God receive doctrine, and they that can understand obtain it.
154:9 Let him that is willing be obedient to the commandments, and they that are well-pleasing to Him shall find everlasting life.

155:1 O Lord, I have cried unto Thee; hearken unto me.
155:2 I have lifted up my hands to Thy holy dwelling-place; incline Thine ear unto me.
155:3 Grant me my request; withhold not from me my petition.
155:4 Build up my soul, and destroy it not; and lay it not bare before the wicked.
155:5 May the judge of truth turn away from me the rewards of evil, O Lord.
155:6 O Lord, judge me not in Thy wrath, neither chasten me in Thine anger.
155:7 For Thy chastening is upon all, O Lord, and Thy judgment is over all the world.
